14521221223.title: ...her boobs growing again. (Keni)

14522.content:
"Oh, Mortimer. I have been slayed, I perceive my mortal coil coming undone!" Morticia cried out. Her black cat Mortimer watched as his master flay around like a fool.Right before she fell onto the floor. On the floor of her room, Morticia clutched her stomach and moaned in mock pain.

"Slowly, ever so slowly, I feel the last gasp of life travel from my mouth. I cannot stand the burden of pain! Please, Mortimer, end my suffering."

Mortimer jumped from his post, and landed on the floor. Trotting right up to Morticia, and Mortimer licked her face. With a sigh, the girl got up and picked up her feline. Stroking the cat with the palm of her hand.

"Come on, Mortimer. You were supposed to lay on my stomach, what are you doing?" Morticia joked as the cat purred in her arms. Suddenly, her door was knocked upon. Putting the cat down, Mortica made her way to the door. Opening it, Morticia was greeted by a familiar face.

"Ms. Van Bellman, your manager is calling for you." Curtis spoke. Curtis was her personal butler,and someone that Morticia counted as a friend. And on the subject of why she had a personal butler, it was because of her lineage.

You see, Morticia was apart of the Van Bellman family. A line of famous actors, and actresses. Her great-grandmother was in the Hammer movies; her grandmother in the horror pieces of the 60's;and her mom in the films of the 80's to 90's. With her usually playing the role of the "last girl" in flicks. She grew out of that, but still people loved her for those roles. And now, it was Morticia's role in keeping up the family legacy.

Back to the story,Curtis indicated the phone that he was holding, Mortica picked it up to answer.

"Amanda, how you doing?" It was Martin V. Chester, the manager that her mother picked out. Morticia scowled; mother picked Martin because she knew he wouldn't play ball with Amanda's "Morticia" act. And also for the fact that he was a pretty competent manager.

"What do you need, Martin?"

"Well, Amanda, I have a great deal for yo-"

"Is it a commercial?" Morticia played with her nails, she was not doing another commercial again. Last one was to bank on her family name, and also gave her the nickname of "Beef Brothers Girl." "You know the drill on that,Martin."

"Let me finish, some lucky director has decided to pick you for a horror movie he's doing!"

Morticia stood slack jawed at the revelation; Curtis was just about to ask a question, right before he heard the loudest "squee" ever. Calming herself down, Morticia babbled at her manager.

"Where? When? How? Do I need to do put on some makeup? How many are at the audition?"

"Hold on, hold on. Just let me tell you what you want to know." Martin then listed off what he needed from her. Indicating to Curtis that she wanted a pen and paper, Morticia rapidly wrote down the details.Finishing it up, Morticia went back into her room to get dressed.

After a few moments, Morticia came back outside with her Gothic,suit. Black petite coat over a black top. Black slacks going to black, leather shoes. Just black coloration all around. Taking Mortimer with her; Curtis, she and the cat made their way downstairs.

A maid walked up to the trio, and Morticia gave Mortimer to her. Nodding her head, the maid walked off with the cat in her hands. The duo of Curtis and Morticia walked into the garage. Picking a black sedan,Curtis went to the front seat, and Morticia to the back. Opening the garage door, the duo sped off towards their destination.

===


Mortica popped her head into the warehouse, it was a fair size, but the ones her mother went to were bigger.Boxes were covering the walls, and a set was in the middle of being put up. Casually making her way in, Morticia yelled out.

"Hello, is anyone here?"

Curtis followed behind her, as the duo made there way closer into the building, someone came from behind the boxes. A twenty-something year old man walked forward, black hair in the style of a pompadour. A five o' clock shadow was on his face.

"Hello, you must be Amanda Van Bellman, come. I'm Lawrence Tapper." The man said, leading Morticia right to the set.

" I prefer Morticia Darkmoon, thank you very much. So, what do I need to act as?" Morticia said. Lawrence smiled and said to her. "You don't need to do that, you're perfect for the role i'm choosing."

That should've been a red flag, but Morticia didn't quite catch on. Lost in her pride that she could be picked so easily. What did he want from her? Was she supposed to be the villain, the heroine, an additional protagonist? Almost slapping her forehead, she almost forgot an extremely important thing!

"Excuse, but I haven't even gotten the name of this project." Morticia blushed as she said that.

"Oh, no fault on you." Lawrence moved behind a stack of crates, coming back out with a piece of paper. Morticia took it from his hands, and read the title....
14522.title: A star is born!

145221.content:
"The Full-Moon Rising, huh?" Morticia said, looking over the piece of paper. "What is that, a werewolf movie?"

"Yes, but a very... unique one." Lawrence replied. "It's about this timid young woman who's out for a walk in the park one night, when she's suddenly bitten by a female werewolf. The next night, she herself transforms into a werewolf. She meets the werewolf who bit her, and the two must work together to break their curse."

Morticia raised an eyebrow. "Sounds pretty standard." She said. "What makes it so unique?"

"Butt expansion." Lawrence replied without missing a beat.

There was silence in the werehouse as Morticia processed what Lawrence said. Did he actually just say that?

"Butt expansion?" Morticia asked, bewildered.

"Yes." Lawrence answered. "You see, as part of the curse, the afflicted woman's butt grows in size whenever she transforms. She returns to being human in the day, but her butt remains the same size, growing bigger and bigger with each transformation."

Morticia stared at Lawrence, utterly dumbfounded. A werewolf pic... with butt expansion. That was definitely a first for her.

"I understand it sounds perverted, but I wanted to do something fun and unique with the tired old formula." Lawrence said. "I understand if you do not wish to take part. I can contact some other-"

"I'm in." Morticia said suddenly, catching Lawrence off guard.

"R-really?" Lawrence asked. "You would take part in this?"

"Why not." Morticia replied. "Yeah, it sounds bizarre, but in all honesty, I think bizarre is just what the movie world needs. Like you said, werewolf films are a dime a dozen, and barely do anything new. This is a total first, and I love the idea. So, you want me in this flick? You got me!"

Lawrence beemed. "Thank you, Morticia. We're going to make a werewolf movie the likes of which no one has ever seen before!" He declared. "Now, let me see your acting skills!"
-------
The next day, Morticia was back in her home, looking over the script Lawrence had given her. It was truly a weird, weird premise, but as Morticia read the script, she found that Lawrence was putting effort into making it more then just some weird fetish piece.

Characters were likable, there was proper suspense, the butt expansion was weaved into the story surprisingly well, and there were even some creative kills in places. Morticia couldn't help but feel like she made the right choice in supporting this strange little flick.

"This might be my big break, Mortimer." Morticia said to her cat, who was currently laying on the coffee table. "Hell, it might even help other producers make more original werewolf flicks."

She was interrupted by the phone ringing. Heading over to the nearby night stand, Morticia picked it up.

"You're speaking to the scream queen Morticia Darkmoon." Morticia said.

"Morticia? It's Lawrence. Glad I caught you. I've figured out what role you can have in the film." Lawrence said, clearly excited.

"Oh?" Morticia replied.

"Yup, I want you to be the..."
145221.title: The Full-Moon Rising!

choices: Mortica encounters something that changes her
1452212.content:
"...werewolf who bites the main character." Lawrence exclaimed, the voice over the line was ecstatic with its delivery.

Mortica smiled at her position, she was going to be the villain! Admittedly, she did was going to ask if that position was open. Her family was always the heroine of their films, it was refreshing that she could be the antagonist.

"That is awesome, Lawrence. So, what is my character's emotions and thoughts?"

"You see, your character possess a rich backstory..." The day continued on, both director and actress discussed their ideas. Finally after Mortica felt like she had enough in conversation, she politefully ask Lawrence to stop.

"Alright, i'll see you tomorrow. We'll start with some pre-filming scenes with your character, Morticia. I want to see how you act her out and what you can do with her." Lawrence said. Mortica was petting Mortimer gently, giddy at the thought of her first acting gig.

"Will do, adios Lawrence" Mortica replied, she playfully saluted the conversation off. Mortimer was snuggled on her lap, he watched his master pump her fist a little.

"Well Mort, I've put my first step into the land of acting. Can't wait for tomorrow." Mortica headed towards the bathroom, doing her normal routine. She washed her face, brushed her teeth, and then dressed in her pajamas. After she was finished, Mortica went back into the room and jumped onto the bad. Mortimer jumped a little do to the force his master came on the bed.
====


Morticia was driven by Curtis to the warehouse, first thing in the morning. She headed into the warehouse and discovered that all the boxes were open and equipment was everywhere.

"Woooh,that was quick."

"Not much, we've been going all night." Lawrence alerted Mortica to his presence,she turned around and beheld a disgruntled Lawrence.

"We?" Morticia asked

"Yeah, I hired a few people to help me unpack the equipment. That took me about....um....eight hours or so. Nevermind that, are you ready to get some scenes?"

"Am I ever!"
1452212.title: The villain

14522122.content:
The first scenes that Lawrence wanted to work on involved Morticia's character, Emily Foley, before she became a werewolf. The scenes involved Emily's backstory working in a museum, the tragic death of Emily's parents, and the events that lead up to Emily's werewolf curse.

Today's scene required Morticia to collect an artifact from the warehouse it was kept in (the artifact, Morticia learned, was a marble wolf figurine sculpted by a nearby art college). As she read over the script to memorize her lines, Morticia happened to notice two women talking to some of the crew.

One of them was a tall elderly woman she didn't recognize. The other was a beautiful Japanese-American woman Morticia knew all to well. She motioned for Lawrence to come over.

"What's up, Morticia?" Lawrence asked.

Morticia pointed to the Japanese-American woman. "Is that who I think it is?" Morticia asked.

"Yup. Michelle Aoki. She's our leading lady, our timid heroine." Lawrence answered.

Morticia was quite happy. Michelle was a HIGHLY popular model and actress, having been in the business for 20 years now. She was Morticia's hero, and her first real celebrity crush.

Even in her early 40's, Michelle didn't look a day over 22. She was 5'7'', with long, shiny black hair and lovely green eyes. She possessed a modest bust, trim stomach, and a tight butt. At the moment, she was wearing a track suit.

"Michelle's here today to see her co-star in action before she starts filming her scenes." Lawrence said.

Morticia couldn't contain her joy. Not only was this her first role, but it was alongside her idol? This day couldn't get better. Then she remembered something.
"Who is the old woman?" Morticia asked.

"Miriam West." Lawrence answered. "She's the local expert on lycanthropy, so we brought her on as a consultant."

Morticia nodded, and moved to prepare for her first scene of the movie. Unknown to her, Miriam had been muttering something under her breath. A little magic for both Morticia and Michelle that, in her mind, would make the film much more realistic.
-----
"I told you idiots to be careful! If I get back to the museum and even ONE of them is damaged, you all will be looking for new jobs!" Morticia yelled at the two workers who dropped the wolf figurine. The three of them then walked out of view of the camera.

"Cut!" Lawrence yelled. "Morticia, that was spectacular! I could really feel the rage there!"

Thanks, Lawrence." Morticia happily replied. "I had to play an angry customer in an advertisment for a computer company, so I know my way around anger."

Lawrence beemed. "OK, people, we've still got daylight to burn! Let's set up for the first museum scene!" He announced.

As everyone scrambled to prepare the next shoot, Morticia saw Michelle walk up to her.

"Morticia, right?" Michelle said. "You did fantastic today. Michelle Aoki, though you've probably already heard of me."

"Heard of you? You're my hero!" Morticia yelled. "I come from a family of actress, but I still looked up to you when I was starting out." She then realized she didn't properlly introduce herself. "Oh right. My real name's Amanda Van Bellman, but I prefer Morticia Darkmoon."

"Van Bellman?" Michelle asked, intrigued. "You wouldn't happen to be related to Selena Van Bellman, would you?"

"She's my mother." Morticia replied.

"I worked with her on The Creature from Cauldron Cave." Michelle remembered. "She was a wonderful person. I'm glad to be able to work with her daughter."

Morticia felt like her heart was going to explode. This was likely one of the happiest days of her life.
------
Hours later, Morticia returned home and practically danced in her room. The filming had gone fantastic, Lawrence made for an incredible director, and she was officially on good terms with her childhood hero.

"Everything about today was just fantastic! Can't wait for the rest of the shoot!" Morticia declared, grabbing Mortimer and hugging him.

Morticia, though, was unaware of just what the next few days would bring.
---------
Later that night, Morticia was sleeping, dreaming of bigger film roles and red carpet events. But when the moon shined through her window, she began...
14522122.title: Co-Stars and Consultants

145221222.content:
The shining moon beamed down at the girl, who was currently under the auspice of the sphere. Ever so slowly did the effects start to appear on her.

First a growl formed in her chest, a bestial sound that couldn't come from a human.If Morticia ever heard it, she didn't react to it at all. The growl kept on its blast, it swelled out from her, Next came a sickly breaking sound, it was her bones that grew. Like a tower being built, her height increased by the margin. Finally that ended and her legs grew over the foot of her bed. Morticia's blanket couldn't cover that part of her anymore. She was currently anywhere between six to seven feet at the moment.

Mortimer was awoken by the creaking of his mistress's bed, lazily opening his eyes, Mortimer saw what was had transpired. The feline could only watch as more changes piled onto his mistress.

After her height growth, Morticia grew a dark pattern on her body. Large patches of fur rippled forth from her skin. The currently sleeping Morticia struggled in her bed, her body reacted to the warmth of her blanket. She flung the cotton sheet over her body, it landed in a pile. A wolfish noise escaped from her mouth, satisfied with it's accomplishment. The hair already on her scalp grew into a wild mane of fur, it grew so long it reached her hips.

On the subject of that.

Her hips grew wider, it gained mass from a unknown source. It grew and grew, until they both passed her shoulders. And her hips weren't the only thing that grew near her lower area. Her once perky, but small, butt-cheeks gained mass. They blew up like balloons on an air-tank, reaching sizes that Morticia couldn't even relate to her posterior. The fur that was on her kept up with the expansion of flesh. The final touch of her butt growth ended with the appearance of a tail. The Wolf-Morticia growled in discomfort, the tail currently under all the weight of her.

The final touches of her transformation arrived after this, Morticia's snout grew longer. It's appearance started to resemble that of a canine than that of a human. Underneath her eyelids, her once striking brown eye turned into yellow canine. The Wolf-Morticia huffed in appreciation of its new existence, it opened its eyes to see the world.

It moved it arms above its head, and stretched a little. Morticia's bed deformed more and more as Wolf-Morticia kept it butt planted on it. Now, what mindset was Wolf-Morticia in?

1452212222.content:
"Hrm" The Wolf whimpered out. This was the first day of its existence and it was quite confused about...well everything.

What was it? Who was it? What was this place Wh-Squirrel! The Wolf looked over to the window and saw the scampering little beast on the tree. Flinging her large ass off the bed, which audibly creaked in relief. The Wolf rammed against the wall,which caused the squirrel to stare at the window in shock and ran down the tree.

The Wolf,having trace amounts of Morticia in her, unlocked the window with her long claws, and stuck her head out the window. The Wolf growled,trying its best to find the beast. Not smelling a thing, The Wolf pulled back inside. She growled for a few minutes, until she saw her a tail. Whose tail was it? Whose?

She was stared a few minutes in thought, then she went forth to snatch it!

Who was this animal? She ran around the room for minute after minute, she could catch this beast and see what secrets it held. It was after thirty minutes of this that The Wolf huffed for breath. Turning her head around, The Wolf realized it was her own tail she was chasing. What a twist!

Licking her lips, The Wolf smelt the air from outside. It tickled her nose, smells that enticed her to go outside. She saw the open window and made her move. Rushing forth, The Wolf smacked right into the window frame.

And instead of a graceful shot through the window, it was instead a strange homage to one Winnie The Pooh. Her butt, large and swollen, proudly took the window frame up.

The Wolf yelped in shock and struggled to push out. With her large muscles, The Wolf managed to get out and fling herself down to the ground. She smashed against the concrete pavaliion, it barely did a dent in her body.

Moving up, she looked around towards the weirdly delicious smelling place out in the distance and ran to it.

14522221.content:
"Murder for Milk?" Morticia asked, looking over the title again. "What on Earth is this about?"

"Ah, it's a little odd, but I hope at least unique." Lawrence replied. "It's about a woman who joins a medical trial, but ends up a prisoner of a deranged medical corperation, who have discovered a way to alter breast milk, giving in incredible healing properties. The woman is given a drug that causes her breasts to grow to tremendous sizes and fill with this milk, and she's forced to find a way out of her prison and expose the horrors of this company. As for the 'Murder' part of the title, people who try to help your character, or people who get too close to what's going on, are killed by the corporation, and you're character does end up killing a few people in the films climax."

Morticia stared at Lawrence, completely baffled. This was possibly one of the oddest movie plots she'd ever heard of. But she did have to admit, it was certainly unique.

"And I'm assuming my role in this is the woman who is made to grow?" Morticia asked.

"That is correct." Lawrence replied. "She's an average woman who needs money desperately. She's resourceful, plucky, and refuses to give up."

"Sounds interesting." Morticia said. "I'm guessing this is an erotic horror flick?"

Lawrence shook his head. "No, actually. Despite the premise, there's no sex. The villains of the film are purely practical. In fact, you'll be spending most of the film all by yourself. A woman trapped by her body, left alone in a cell, trying to stave off madness as she works on a plan for escape." He explained.

"Now THAT sounds like a fascinating film!" Morticia said. "I do have one more question: my character's boobs. How big are we talking?"

Lawrence turned and pointed at a wheelbarrow. It was dark green, and looked like it could feet a few yoga balls.

"See that wheelbarrow?" Lawrence said. "Your characters boobs are going to be filling it up. Due to the weight of your characters boobs, you need it to carry them around."

Morticia whistled. "That is big, I'll admit." She said. "You know what? I'm in. This flick sound bizarre, but I think that's what Hollywood needs."

Lawrence beemed. "That's fantastic!" He shouted happily. "We'll start casting for the few other characters in the film, and then we can start filming."

"Great." Morticia said. "But, um, how am I supposed to play the character? Do you have a set of prosthetic breasts I'm supposed to wear, or do you want me to get the craziest plastic surgery ever?"

"We're working on that." Lawrence said. "For now, let's focus on the scenes where you're normal sized."
--------
About 2 weeks passed since Morticia agreed to join the film, and production was going smoothly. They had managed to shoot all of the scenes where Morticia was just normal sized (which she found out were only the first half hour. The characters growth was evidentally permanent.). Now it was time to film the scene where Morticia was injected with the breast growth drug. Morticia was already wearing a hospital gown, and was speaking to Lawrence.

"OK Morticia." Lawrence said. "I need to warn you. You are about to be pricked with a real needle. It will pinch a bit, but it shouldn't be too bad."

"And the formula they put in the needle for the scene. What is that?" Morticia asked, clearly worried.

"Something safe." Lawrence replied. "I spoke with a local hospital, and they gave me a harmless chemical that should dissolve in your bloodstream, and not hurt you. If anything goes wrong, I'll stop filming and rush you to the hospital. If it's really bad, I'm scrapping the film. I want this flick made, but not at the cost of my actors life."

Morticia smiled. "You're better then most directors." She said. With that, she took her place on set, a mock hospital room. She lay down on the hospital bed, and the actor playing the doctor walked up to her.

"Before we start, I want to say it's great to work with you." The actor replied. "My parents are big fans of your moms work."
"Good to hear." Morticia replied.

"QUIET ON SET!" Lawrence yelled into his megaphone. "Remember people, we're doing this scene in one take. I don't want to put Morticia in the emergancy room, so let's make this count."

Everyone took their places, and Morticia braced herself.

"Drug injection scene, take one!" Lawrence yelled. "ACTION!"

The actor pulled out a needle from his labcoat pocket, and tapped it a few times. Pushing the plunger a little to get air bubbles out, the actor turned to Morticia.

"Don't worry, Miss Blake." The actor replied. "This formula is completely harmless. It will put you to sleep for a bit, but otherwise you'll be fine."

"I hope so doctor." Morticia replied, faking worry.

The actor proceeded to stick the needle into Morticia's arm, and injected the harmless chemical. Morticia let her eyes flutter a little, then faked passing out.

The actor removed the needle, cleaned the injection point, and pulled out a fake phone. Dialing a number, he raised it to his ear.

"It's done. The experiment can proceed." The actor said.

"CUT!" Lawrence yelled. "Wonderful people! Got it in one!"

Morticia opened her eyes and looked at the actor, smiling.

"Thanks for not killing me." Morticia joked, before hopping off the bed and going over to Lawrence.

"Nice job Morticia." Lawrence said. "You're a natural."

"Thanks, Lawrence." Morticia replied. "Hopefully, this film'll be a great success."

Morticia and Lawrence continued to talk about the upcoming scenes they needed to film. Unknown to either of them, or anyone on set, the "harmless chemical" Morticia was injected with did have an effect. One that was about to make life imitate art.
-------
Later that night, at home, Morticia was laying in bed, re-reading the film's script. She had already memorized every word, but it was still a fascinating read.

As she did, though, a change was happening in her chest. Slowly, her boobs, a modest B cup, began swelling. Not enough to be noticable, but it still happened. Almost as quick as it started, it ended, adding only a few inches to Morticia's bust. There was another effect though, in that Morticia's boobs also started producing milk, though she wasn't lactating.

Morticia absent-mindedly brushed her hand over her bust, and realized it felt...

145233.content:
Barbara Tina-Anna Ricci: Barbara isn't just any girl,but a member of the "Twelve Months of Amazement!" The headline performers of the "Cobalt World," one of the last performing circuses in the U.S.A. And also one that can keep itself afloat.

The act consists of: her three siblings, her mom and dad, her aunts and uncles, and her two cousins.

Barbara's role in all of this is the clown, who opens the act. The young girl loves every part of her job, doing it vigorously for six years. Right until a week ago when she got her first phone. Now being curious about the outside world, Barbara decided to check in on what the country thought of her profession. The girl was shocked to see how much hate her fellows received and decided on one course of action: show the country why clowns are awesome!

The thing is, she may have chosen the wrong way to go about it.

14523311.content:
"I can't believe this! Inconceivable! Preposterous! Audacious!" Barbara proclaimed on her bed. Currently out of her clown persona, Barbara laid down opposite to one of her family members.

"Completely not true?" Charlie, her youngest sister, snarked. Looking up from her magazine to stare at her older sibling. Barbara looked at her with a smile and shot her with a finger gun.

"You got that right! I mean, who doesn't love clowns?"

"I would lose some love for them if I had to clean pie out of my hair every once in awhile."

"Pfft. You that is the best way to eat baked confectionery,cream based, desserts!" Barbara accused.

"Or finding strands of clown hair around the house because the clown doesn't wanna clean up after herself." Charlie said, now sitting atop of her bed.

"Maybe the clown doesn't see all of that?"

"Or what about the clown's face honking her nose against the trailer walls whenever a bump happens?"

"That is just physics doing its work! Besides that,why would people hate clowns?" Barbara said. "I mean, its just....just...BWAHH!"

Barbara cried in an exaggerated action, taking out a handkerchief from her coat pocket to wipe her invisible tears. Charlie rolled her eyes as she watched her older sister do the skit for a few minutes. She eventually stopped and using her hiccuped. Charlie clapped her hands to show she appreciated her show.

"Wow, you're getting better at this. Those hiccups sounded pretty good."

"Thanks, dad's lessons have been really sticking for the past few days. I think I can even mimic his range of performances. But that aside, where did this clown-dread come from?" Barbara announced.

"I think the proper term is 'Coulrophobia,' I seen it on the internet." Charlie offered. "And as for an answer, I think people started seeing something off about your profession."

"Off? We only want to bring joy to others and have them smile for us using a bunch of objects that look innocent,but are instead a cause of paranoia!" Barbara moaned. Charlie was about to interrupt with another comeback, but Barbara didn't allow it to continue.

"I got something! You know our 'Twelve State Tour' is coming up right?" Barbara said.

"Yes. I live here with you, I know." Charlie responded.

"I'm just giving out setting lore for an audience, okay. So I got a little something cooking in the oven up here." Barbara tapped the side of her head. "How about I make my entire act based around why clowns are awesome! I can see it now; three months worth of clown antics starring: ME!"

Barbara held her arms open and waited for the applause, to which Charlie gladly offered. The clown girl smiled and went to her drawer, opening it, she pulled out her red nose to honk it. The thing puffed out a pathetic sound, to which the girl gave a confused look. Her face slowly morphed into a mask of horror at the sight.

"Horatio! NO! Why!?! You were only three days away from retirement!" Barbara cried.

Charlie actually rubbed the back of her head at this. "Ouch, I can actually feel this one. You had that thing since the start of your career, gosh Barb."

Barbara stood up glumly and ruffled through the drawer. Grabbing a hold of something, she pulled it out to reveal an old plastic bag. Putting the depuffed honk nose in it, she gently wrapped it around the object. Slowly putting the nose back inside.

"At least this gives me the excuse to buy a new one." Barbara joked, but with a tiny hint of sadness. Walking out of the tiny room,Charlie watched through the window as Barbara walked into the changing tent, no doubt going into town.
====

"Morning,Slippy!" A citizen of Evansville offered. "Slippy," better known as Barbara, waved at the man. A huge grin was on her face,though she still felt incomplete without her prized nose. The Cobalt Theater were the local celebrities of the mid-sized town, almost every person who lived there knew of the performers,especially one of the "Twelve Months of Amazement."

Her exaggerated walk caused a kid to stop while holding his mother's hand, pointing at the girl. Barbara saw this, and instantly jumped across the road to greet the child. He didn't seem afraid, in fact he seemed quite happy at seeing her. She reached into her large purse, various sound bits came from inside of it. Finally, Barbara smiled and held out a wrapped sucker and offered it to the boy,who gladly took it. Waving off to him,she walked away.

"Hmm, now were could I go to buy a new clown nose? I got Horatio all the way in New York that one time we were taking a vacation. I don't know where else to buy it." She stopped as she saw something flick in the corner of her eye. Looking beside her was a new shop with the sign "Albrecht's Crazy Gifts and Tricks."

Seeing nothing wrong with this picture, Barbara shrugged and popped right inside. Her eyes adjusted as to the dim lighting of the place, but upon doing so, her mouth widened. Various crafts,gifts,and jokes were displayed and Barbara felt like a child in a candy store.

"Enjoy what you see?" A voice with a slight German accent spoke. Barbara turned her head to see a small,bald man walk out from the shadows. Peering at him, the clown girl watched as he walked closer to her.

"The efforts of forty years of collecting all in one space.But allow me to introduce myself, Albrecht." The German said.

"Albrecht...?" Barbara questioned.

"Just Albrecht. Now then, you need a new nose right?" Albrecht questioned. Barbara's mouth widened upon hearing him say that. Her eyes narrowing to find out how he knew that.

"How..?"

He tapped his own nose in response and Barbara quickly caught on. Smacking her own head at her own forgetfulness. Albretcht smiled and motioned for her to follow him. She was wary,but complied. What could a small,old man do to her? He walked behind one of the glass counters and raised a hand to stop Barbara from following. Crouching down, a light shuffling was heard before the old man appeared again, now holding a small case.

"Just pick whatever you like." Albrecht spoke,opening the case to reveal three noses. A pink one, a purple one, and a blue one. Barbara's eyes sparkled at the sight, reaching forward a little. She could finally have an all colored, complementing clown outfit, but which one could she use? Playing a metaphorical game in her head, Barbara grabbed a hold of the purple one. Smiling, the man closed the case and waited as Barbara inspected it

Seeing something that only appealed to her sense, Barbara pulled her wallet out before Albretcht stopped her.

"No need, think of it as a 'Complimentary gift' for a first time customer. Let me just ring you up." Albretcht's hand was open for Barbara to give him the nose, she allowed him to take it. Following him as he typed the nose into an old-fashioned register. Nodding his head, Albretcht placed the nose back into Barbara's hand. She smiled, waving as she made her way out of the store.

Upon reaching the outside, Barbara wiped the nose off with her clothing. Moving it directly on top of her nose, she planted it on. Strangely she felt a small shiver as she did so, making Barbara feel...weird. It was probably nothing,right?
14523311.title: Barbara's New Nose(Hourglass)

choices: Barbara felt a sense of easing pressure inside of herself,was she imaging it?
Barbara stared at her curves, what was going on?
145233112.content:
She flopped down the street,completing her goal for today. "Her" goal being the word of the day, putting a hand into her bag, Barbara pulled out a list. She peered at it with her eye, mentally checking off what she needed to do next.

"Carrots for the horses; Milk for Charlie; Nail polish for mom..."

"Mom, look, its: Sticky!" A young girl's said, somewhere between a yell and a very loud voice. Barbara turned to her right to stare at a blonde haired moppet and her mother. She quickly placed the list back into her purse to walk over to the duo. The blonde young one smiled at Barbara and whose mother offered a small wave.

"Morning, Ba-Slippy." The mother said.

"Morning,Ms. Gillian. How's the day going for you and Sarah." Barbara said, lightly patting Sarah on the head. Ms. Gillian was the woman who made the pies for Barbara skit,meeting her four years ago when Barbara was looking for a new baker. Ever since then, the two had developed a close relationship, turning into a trio once Sarah was born.

"Splendid, I also see you got a new nose for yourself. What happened to you other one? I thought "Horatio" was your favorite." Ms.Gillian questioned.

"I'm sad to say that Horatio has gone to the great clown car in the sky." Barbara placed her forearm above her had and dramatically sighed. "Anypoo, I got a new nose right here, I'm calling her Violet."

"Nice to meet you,Violet" Sarah excitedly said. Barbara gave the small girl a giant grin. Barbara and Ms. Gillian talked,while Sarah held onto her mother's hand, all the way down the street. They stopped,with Barbara talking to Ms.Gillian for a bit. Feeling like the conversation was coming to a close, Barbara was about to leave,but didn't move once she heard the music coming from the park.

"What's going on?" Barbara asked. Ms. Gillian smirked as she heard the question.

"Its Founder's Day,today. You ask me the same question every year. Now aren't you going to walk with me to see my husband? You know he enjoys it when you help him out." The mother responded.Ms. Gillian walked towards the largest of the gathering, while Barbara frowned before puffing herself up.

"Note to self: remember the date next year." She probably wouldn't, but that didn't deter Barbara from walking towards the source of festivity. Maneuvering around the crowd, Barbara smiled at the joyous crowd. Either at the stalls, the temporary games, or even talking to some of her circus mates! Barbara mentally slapped herself at forgetting the event again,still she basked in all of it.But what really made catch her eyes was the balloon animal maker,who was currently on break. She rushed over to him and smiled as she found Mr.Gillian casually talking with his wife,their daughter eating a scoop of ice cream.

"And so I said-Slippy! Nice of you to join us! Ready to do what we do every year?" The man said. Barbara clapped her hands together and rubbed them like she was about to start a fire,

"Balloon Animals? Yes,please." Barbara moved forward, she pulled up a stool that was unoccupied. Sitting down, she raised her thumb up for Mr. Gillian to see. He replied with his own gesture, and with it, ranged a small bell to show off that everything was ready. A crowd of kids heard it, and rushed. over with their chaperone,they must've been on a class field trip.

A cacophony of voice all called out, drowning out their own chaperone. This would've been daunting to most people,but Barbara saw this every time a show was beginning.She waited as Mr. Gillian lugged over a air canister.Barbara's hands twiddled in the air as she hyped herself to work.

===

"And a cow comes last in the race!" Barbara said to the little girl. She hugged it and walked back into her group,who were gossiping about their new toys. Barbara smiled at the scene. Seven of the fifteen children sized group broke off from it to walk over to Barbara.

"Ms. Slippy, aren't you going to honk your horn?" A young boy asked. Barbara grin, herself ready to test out her new nose. Raising her hand over it, she dramatically placed two fingers on it. Closing them together, she honked her nose.

HONK HONK

Instantly, Barbara felt something about her change. Whatever it was, none of the kids seemed to mind it, only laughing at the noise her hose made. Doing her to stay calm, she waved the kids off as the disappeared back into their group. Wiping her forward, Barbara turned around. and contemplated what had just happened.

Crossing her arms against her chest, Barbara's eyes winded as she realized something. She had a chest! Pulling her shirt forward a little, Barbara was about to yell, but stopped herself. Greeting her,where normally flat skin was, were instead two B-cup sized breasts. She gawked at this,but closed her shirt as she realized children were walking about.

"What is this?" Barbara thought. "Why the heck do I have boobs?"
145233112.title: Park Antics

1452331122.content:
For her entire life, Barbara hadn't had much of a figure. She sometimes joked to herself that the "figure fairy" hadn't noticed her. Barbara hadn't minded much, since being a clown didn't exactly require being curvy. Even going into her 20's, Barbara stayed figureless.

So, it was obviously a bit surprising to Barbara to see a pair of breasts on her now.

Right now, with her rather baggy clown clothes, her new assets weren't noticeable, but Barbara still knew they were there. Confused, she placed her hands on her hips... only to discover her hips felt a little wider.

'OK, this is bizarre.' Barbara thought. 'How'd I go from flat as a pancake to the tiniest bit curvy? I wasn't like this an hour ago. Wait... I had that weird feeling when...'

Now a little intrigued, Barbara raised her hands to feel her new clown nose. '...when I honked Violet.'

Deciding on a little test, Barbara honked her clown nose again.

HONK!

Instantly, the odd feeling of change came back. It lasted only for a brief moment, but Barbara still felt it. Barbara looked down at her chest again. Now she could see it was a little bigger. It was now slightly noticeable in her baggy outfit.

'OK, so I got a little curvier when I honked my nose. That is... bizarre. WAIT! That's it! Maybe I can work this into my new act!' Barbara thought happily. 'I'll have to test it out more later.'

The cries from the festival goers pulled Barbara out of her thoughts, and she decided to go back to make people laugh more.
-----
A couple of hours later, Barbara returned to the Cobalt Theater. A couple of her family members had complimented her on her new clown nose.

Barbara entered her trailer. Looking in the mirror, she smiled.

"Well, Barbara, you found something new for your act. How and why my nose made me curvy, I don't know, and right now I don't care." Barbara said to herself. "If this new act works, clowns will be respected again. Should probably put Violet away for now."

Barbara reached up to pull her clown nose off, and...
1452331122.title: A Quick Realization

choices: Barbara tries to play off her appearance.
A balloon drifted into her family's trailer telling her to come to somewhere
14523311222.content:
...it won't come off.

Barbara's hand slipped when she was trying to pull off,honking it of course. It inflated her curves of course, now reaching double-B cups, but that didn't connect with her brain at the moment. She stared at her "nose" in confusion, looking at it. Her hand slowly moved back upwards to grab ahold of it,as to redo the previous action. It was a repeat of the previous scene; curves grow,no nose show. At this point Barbara was a small C-cup,but still she was more enamored with the purple ball on her face.

"What is going on?" She exclaimed. She scratched her head in confusion-but strangely not distress- before something else caught her eye. She gently held a length of her hair in her hand,she gasped in shock. Her hair was the exact same color of her wig--that is purple--which wasn't on her hair at the minute. She turned her head to look at the bed,her wig was sprawled on it. She turned back and forth between her own locks and her wig, as if looking at each of them would change reality.

"Okay,now this isn't funny anymore." She called out. She should've have said that when she saw her curves grow,but hey, hindsight is twenty-twenty. She puckered her lips in though as she took in everything. But another problem caught her eyes.

"Is..is my skin turning white?" She stated dumbly. And true to her speech it was, Barbara's skin was creeping along the length of her body as it became chalk white,the same color as her normal makeup. She swiftly headed towards her faucet, placing her hands in water and splashing her face. She grabbed a towel by the side of her, rubbing her face vigorously. Looking up, she gasped in horror as nothing seemed to be rubbing off.

Barbara's panic became worse as she stared at her entire body; her new nose, her enhanced curves, her colored hair, her white skin, and her enlarged feet...wait.

Like planes landing on an airstrip, Barbara's face zoomed onto her feet. Her once woman's seven feet were becoming size eight, and didn't seemed to be stopping there. She didn't do anything at all,only moaning out her complaints to the wind.

"No, please, no." The usually joyous girl pleaded. "Why is this happening to me?"

Her feet came to a stop in enlarging, but it was now forever changed. If one were to compare her feet to another, she would be a size twelve...men's. Barbara stood still in her trailer now, basking in her surreal situation.
====
Elsewhere, a woman stood in atop of a hill overlooking the circus site. Holding binoculars in her hands, she slowly lowered them to her side.Pulling out what appeared to be a toy walkie-talkie, the woman spoke into it.

"It's me. Yes. It's done, I'll see you back at base." The woman's voice was deep, yet, feminine. This same voice belonged to someone with the right features to hold them. Her eyes contained a certain coldness to them, as well as possessing a matriarch's glare.

This entire ensemble quickly broke apart if a stranger were to see the rest of her. Wearing what could only be described as a business suit mixed with a clown's costume.A moderate business skirt chimera with frills and bells attached to it;buttons with subtle smiley faces engraved in them; and an undershirt with blue swirls in them.The clothing's was patterned with blue teardrops on a light grey background. And around this woman's neck was a large neck ruff, the one noble's wore back in the Elizabethan area.

Her skin was as pale, but not to Barbara's extent, though, still noteworthy to mention. On her face was a blue,clown nose. Two blue dots were colored on her cheeks. On her face was a blue,clown nose,a little bit bigger than Barbara's. The only thing that was normal on her head was her hair, which was brunette, but even that was ruined by the weaves and goofy looking tied strands of hair.

But of all the things that made the woman unique, one part of her stood above--or below--the rest.

Her rear.

While nothing to scoff at in the hip-side of things, this woman's trunk was a whole lot to talk about. It was wider than her shoulders, and it stood out two feet behind her. It strained her skirt, it was a miracle it didn't rip the poor thing open. It was also moderate enough to cover the entire backside,but it still didn't leave much to the imagination of how big she was.

This clown woman also had some form of grace, as she quickly walked away from the area. Hell, she did it without jiggling her rear, or even waddling. Possessing a strange pride that allowed her not to be seen as some buffoon.
14523311222.title: ...it won't come off.

145233112222.content:
As Barbara stared at her reflection in the mirror, bewildered and frightened by what had happened, she noticed in the mirror something floating through the window. Turning, she saw a pink balloon float into the room. Confused, she walked over to it carefully, doing what she could to not trip over her newly enlarged feet.

Staring at the balloon for a moment, Barbara poked it, hoping it wouldn't suddenly pop. When it didn't, she gently grabbed the balloon. Now more confused, she turned the balloon over, and saw something attached to it. It was a piece of paper, a garrish coloring of pink, purple, and orange. There was writing on it. Barbara removed the note and read it. The note read:

'To Slippy the Clown. We are aware of what is happening to you at the moment. And we can explain what is going on. On the bank of the nearby river, there will be a circus caravan. Go there, and we will explain this to you.'

Barbara stared at the note for a little bit. Did someone really know why this was happening to her? Maybe she could entertain the idea. They could have some sort of answer.

Then again, this could be some kind of trick. These people could have set this up as a prank, or something worse. Barbara wasn't sure what to do.

As she wondered, she happened to glance back at her mirror, and saw she had changed a little more. Her lips had turned a bright, sparkly pink, and her hair had somehow styled itself into a small frizzy ponytail without the need of a hairband.

At that moment, Barbara decided she had nothing to lose. Grabbing a pencil and some paper, she wrote a note saying she was heading out for a little while, and left it on her dresser. On that, she grabbed a jacket, and left her dressing room.
-------
A little while later, Barbara arrived at the river. It took some doing, since she kept tripping over her feet. In fact, she was starting to wonder if they had grown another shoe size. That would not be good.

Eventually, she saw something. Just as the note said, there was a caravan sitting on the riverbank. It seemed... plain. There were some laterns on the caravan lighting it up.

In front of the caravan was a figure. It seemed the figure noticed Barbara, and walked up to her. As it got close, Barbara realized the figure was another clown girl. But this clown girl had...
145233112222.title: The Caravan on the Riverbank

choices: One of Barbara's siblings happens upon this strange scene.
1452331122221.content:
A blue clothed woman was gently peeling an orange in front of the plain caravan. She glanced at Barbara as the younger girl moved towards her, not even lowering her orange. She peeled off the last remaining visage of the orange's skin,revealing the succulent fruit underneath.

Barbara, meanwhile, was sizing up the woman that lead nonchalantly on the vehicle. Each step was a measured reading on what this individual wanted from her.
Something did make Barbara raise an eye though.

"Its weird that she's wearing a crinoline on such a short skirt. Heck, its weird that such lady as this is dressed as a clown!" Barbara thought. She soon stopped four feet in front of this strange lady and raised an eyebrow at her. The two women stood silently away from each other, right before the blue clown handed a piece of the orange over. Barbara took the piece hesitantly and gently plucked it into her mouth.

"Hello, Slippy" The woman spoke, her voice deep, yet feminine. "We've been waiting for you."

"Me? And whose 'we'?" The younger woman replied. The woman's eyes glanced back towards the caravan, probably indicating other inhabitants of the van. The lady continued on with her speech.

"They're not here right now, so I'll be your consultant for tonight. And as to who we are.My group is of exemplar individuals who've been overseeing your work and have chosen you to be a new member of our coterie."

"And who might I be speaking to from this 'coterie', if i'm allowed to ask?" Barbara questioned.

"My name is Prudence, or often shortened to, Prude." Prudence confidently replied. Barbara's eyebrow rose higher at that pure strangeness she had heard. The woman, whose eyes held a tight firmness to them, confidently called herself 'Prude' in front of Barbara. Shaking her head, the young entertainer asked another question.

"So, does your coterie have anything to do with this?" Barbara pointed down to her transformed body. Prude nodded, turning around, Barbara gaped at the surreal sight of Prudence's lower half. A monumental ass of fetish proportions.

"If you just follow me inside" Prudence walked forth and wiggled her way into the caravan's doors. It squished the rear, but yet the twin spheres managed to get into the automobile's doorway.

14523312.title: How about..

145233121.content:
Almost everyone in the world loves a good circus. With it's high-flying trapeze artists, wonderful animal tricks, and death-defying stunts, there is always something for everyone.

And at every circus, you'll find clowns. People in loud make-up and brightly colored clothing, their job is to perform humorous antics and make the audience laugh along with them.

Unfortunately, not everyone thinks clowns are funny. Many find them creepy, and tend to characterize them as criminals or monsters. As such, the reputation of the actual funny clown has been hurt. And no one knows that hurt more then Barbara Ticci-Anna Ricci.

Barbara's family were the "Twelve Months of Amazement", a circus group named so because each member (Barbara herself, her parents and three sibling, her aunt and uncle, and her two cousins) was born in one of the year's twelve months, and each go in order of the month born (Barbara was born in February, so she goes second). The group traveled with Cobalt World, one of the last performing circuses in the USA.

Barbara was the groups clown, having started her career at 18. Now 24, Barbara was a professional at her job, and fairly well known in the clown community but in all honesty, she just loved being a clown. So much so that even when she wasn't working, she continued to wear her costume and make-up. It made it easy to spot her in a crowd, with her bright pink and purple clown wig, big red clown nose, white make-up with bright red lipstick, and huge pink clown shoes. Her bright pink overalls and frilly purple shirt fit well on her fairly slim frame.

And she always sought to make people smile and laugh. She always told jokes, performed goofy antics, and generally tried to be a ray of sunshine whenever people felt down.

In the last week, though, she had finally gotten a phone (she'd been putting it off due to not wanting to be distracted from entertaining), and learned of all the hate that clowns tended to get, leading to where we meet her now.
-----
It was just after another show, and The Twelve Months of Amazement were resting in their rather large trailer. The show had gone rather well, with Barbara's clown act and the magic show being the most popular. Though Barbara was somewhat frustrated.

"Hey, Bar-Bar." Barbara's mom, Corrine (the circus fortune teller born in May) said, using Barbara's clown name. "What's up? You're not still upset about that news article, are you?"

"It's not just that." Barbara replied, running a hand through her clown wig. "Hollywood's releasing 3 movies where a clown is the villain. We're supposed to make people laugh, not scream."

"I know it's frustrating, Barbara. But none of it is your fault." Corrine replied. "There are still people out there who loves clowns as much as you love being one." She then looked at the clock. "Oh, sorry. I need to go open the fortune-tellers tent. People really want to see their future." With that, Corrine departed, leaving Barbara to her thoughts.

'I know mom's right, but it's still annoying.' Barbara thought. 'It shouldn't bug me. I'm 24, a professional, and people love me, but that might not be enough. Maybe, just maybe, if I spice up my routine a little, I can help people understand clowns are funny. But what to do...'

After thinking for a moment, Barbara thought up a new routine involving...
145233121.title: A Clown's Concern

choices: She prepares for a rehearsal; here we see her circus' dynamic
She tests it out on some plants, unaware that its quite differently in people
1452331211.content:
"How about something based off a famous movie? If Hollywood is going to release movies about evil clowns, then I can use movies to fight against them. I mean figuratively; I don't think we have a budget for a major motion picture." Barbara proclaimed. "I know my parents have a bunch of props in the communal storage center! And not just any props:movie props! They keep buying all of that for funsies, but yet they never use them. Well, I can't let them just catch dust, now can I?"

Barbara then looked around the trailer, seeing as she just had a monologue in front of the air.

Shrugging,the clown girl swiftly grabbed a hold of her parents' key to open the place and went towards the door.Going outside her the trailer, Barbara could see the rest of the circus performing for the various visitors or preparing for later. The first thing Barbara saw outside was her older brother,Humphrey, hard at work. Spinning a baton that was currently on fire, sweat beaded off his forehead from the flame's heat. Yet, the young man's face didn't show any signs of strain or frustration, just concentration.

"Ciao~, Humphrey" Barbara called out to her sibling. The man grunted a "Hello," all the while not even dropping his baton once. Barbara stepped past him heading towards the storage place. Walking with exaggerated steps,Barbara waved to her fellows in the circus. They smiled or called out a hello,but went back to work. And Barbara did her best not to disturb them too greatly, for what they were preparing for was the biggest event for the circus.

The Cobalt Theater would soon go on its twelve state tour; traveling from their home state of Georgia and heading west to California.An event that only happened once every two years and which Barbara only participated in twice in her clownsona. Now thinking about it, Barabara was slowly getting pumped up for what would her act would be. Which, given that she didn't know what she would do, still didn't dampen her mood.

"Morning,Barbara!" Her aunt Moira exclaimed, beside her was Barbara's sisters (or Moira's nieces) Peggy and Charlie.Charlie was currently balancing two plates on top of a horse, while Peggy was keeping the beast from running off. A small crowd was around the trio,some turning their heads to stare at Barbara as she walked past them.Peggy flashed her a quick wave,while Charlie just huffed something out.

"Ciao, Auntie Moira!" Barbara responded. Pushing past the trio, Barbara finally came face to face with the storage center; an old rundown building that Mr. Morgan, The Cobalt Theater's manager and ringleader, had bought. Logically,you can't bring a building around with you, so the area around it was the theater's HQ while they stayed in their home state.

Pulling out her parent's key, Barbara fiddled with the lock until it opened with a pop. Pushing the door open, she walked inside. The building barely had any air-conditioning and only a few lights worked and Barbara sweated a little from that fact. A long corridor greeted her,Barbara walked around a little until she found her goal. Opening the door, she marveled at all the paraphernalia laying about in the room. Each and every piece belonging to her parents or her siblings.

"Now lets see what new toys I can find in this store." Barbara moved aside a few boxes, making sure she didn't break anything. And began to open them up. After about twenty minutes or so, Barbara scratched her chin in thought.

"Nothing here speaks to me as an comedian, unless the Jaws, Chinatown, and Citizen Kane were comedy movies." She rolled her eyes,but went back to seeing what else this place had in store for her. And just her luck, the next box she opened contained something that appealed to her senses.

"Whats this?" She asked,bending down to reach inside. Picking it up, she stared at the seltzer bottle. "Its seltzer water, why would this be here? I don't remember any movie having this."

She turned the bottle around to see the the sticker on it,her eyes widened as she read the logo.

"Blueberry Flavored Seltzer water;made under the Wonka brand. I never knew Willy Wonka had this marketed,huh." Barbara exclaimed. "WAIT! I got a light-bulb in my head that is trying to get some power. Come on,come on, bingo! I see it.We can parody a bunch of movies for our opening! And in it we can have a Charlie and the Chocolate Factory skit.I'll be Violet! Oh, we can use lights and my old expanding costume for it to work. I love it! I just have to convince Mr. Morgan and my mom and dad for it to work."

Barbara took the seltzer bottle as she walked out of the room. "I can then plan out how to make clowns awesome again! I think I can change Violet to be something else now that I think about it. Cruelly inflated by bullies? Sacrificing her dignity to make people smile? A joke? Hell, I have a month to plan out what to do."

Barbara had a huge smile on her face as she traveled back to her trailer to tell plan everything out. Unaware of what was in that bottle of seltzer.
1452331211.title: Seltzer:Blueberry?

choices: Barbara has a vision of a blueberry,huh, weird..
Still two days left in planning and Barbara is finishing up misc things
14523312111.content:
"Oooh, this gives off a blueberry aroma. You know what, I should use this in my act!" Barbara spoke to the air. She was currently raising the seltzer bottle she found in her parent's storage."Still, why would they release a brand under seltzer water? I don't think Willy Wonka was popular among the seltzer drinkers."

"Watcha doin'?" Peggy said,coming up right besides where Barbara was sitting. The clown girl ruffled her the second youngest sister's hair.

"I got something from mom and dad's storage,going to make something that will surely make people stop hating clowns!" Barbara declared,raising her hand towards the sky. Peggy giggled at the antic,which made Barbara smile.

"So how does,whatever that is, help clowns in anyway?" Peggy questioned.

"By itself,nothing, but it inspires! And you know what it inspires?" Barbara said to her sister, who shook her head to answer. "Movies! I'm going to put a clown as the centerpiece of each film!"

"But isn't that illegal?"

"Ehh,copyright laws and something like that. The point is that parody isn't illegal." Barbara waved the question off. "Right now I know what my first movie will be, but I'm trying to figure out what i'll do to fill up two and a half months of work!"

"What is your first movie going to be?" Peggy said innocently.

"Depending on the year, 'Charlie and The Chocolate Factory' or 'Willy Wonka.'" Barbara spoke,looking at the seltzer bottle weirdly.

"Why pick that to open the show?"

"Name another movie that has a whimsical feel to it as well as that one? It was a rhetorical question,besides mom and dad have a prop from the movie or at least something of the sort." Barbara held the seltzer bottle up in the air to see the sun peer through the liquid.

"I don't remember a seltzer bottle in either movies"

"Yeah, me neither, but here it is. See,right here." Barbara said, pointing right at the logo and nametag on the bottle. Peggy scratched her head at the fact, but didn't raise too much of a fuss.

"Is it fine to ask you if you need any sibling assistance?" Peggy inquired.

"Sure, I wouldn't leave any of you out. Just get Charlie and Humphrey over here and we'll talk shop!" Barbara responded back.
14523312111.title: Planning a month from now.

choices: A few weeks later, Barbara's still making the routine
2 months later, the night Barbara shows her new routine
145233121111.content:
Later that night, Barbara was just getting ready for bed. She had removed all her clown clothing (it was the only time she ever did during the day), and changed into a surprisingly simple tee-shirt and shorts.

Yawning, Barbara crawled into her bed, still thinking about how to do her Wonka routine. She couldn't completely recreate the movie, she had to find a way to make it her own thing. She had the seltzer, but that wasn't enough.

Laying her head on the pillow, Barbara closed her eyes, and eventually drifted off to sleep.
----
In her dream, Barbara was sitting in the bleachers of the circus, an onlooker to her own show. Crowds of cheering audience members filled the bleachers.

Just then, the lights dimmed. A single spotlight, light-blue, turned on and shined on the center ring. Barbara was curious to see just what was going to happen.

A few second later, there was activity in the center ring. Barbara's aunt and uncle were entering the ring. They were rolling... something odd. It was a massive blue ball, nearly 15 feet tall wrapped in something pink and purple.

Her aunt and uncle stopped rolling the ball, and a number of clowns Barbara didn't recognize descended from the ceiling. They started bouncing on the ball like it was a trampoline. Even from the bleachers, Barbara could hear some sort of liquid sloshing around in the ball. That's when it hit her: this was a giant blueberry.

The clowns stopped jumping on the ball and landed on the ground. They then slowly turned the ball around. It had two smaller, yet still huge spheres on it that looked like breasts. A screen then descended, and turned on. It showed the top of the ball, and what Barbara saw shocked her: it was her own face, coming out of the blueberry.
-----

"Morning Barb." Peggy proclaimed as she rode upon the circus' Arabian stallion. "Got your own little tent for yourself? Whatcha doing in dere that so important?"

Barbara shrugged and mumbled out some stock excuses. Things like "older girl problems" or "weather controlled flu" that sort of thing.Peggy seemed to take the excuses in stride and rode off. Barbara watched her sister for a bit then moved back onward to the circus' performing area.

The town they stopped in was a fairly large mining county, And unfortunately, it seemed the town's official book was the Bible. Normally this wouldn't be that much of a problem, the circus knew how to deal with WASPS, but it was Barbara's current attire that disturbed them greatly.

"How dare you wear such provocative clothing near children?" A woman called out as she laid her hands over her son's eyes. Barbara was currently doing her best to entertain the circus' goers but the occasional jibe like that broke her concentration. Her enhanced rear, even though to their eyes it was just cotton filled pants,made everybody over twenty-one scream in shock or outrage.Usually Barbara was more temperamental; whether it was from her transformation,or frustrations from the transformation,the clown was a little more tense.

"It's just a big butt lady. You seem to have experience with that." Barbara joked to herself. Her aunt Moria could see her distress and brought her own act over.

"You can rest for a bit dear" She whispered into her niece's ear. Barbara nodded in relief. She walked away, giving her bum a nice smack of defiance at the mother's turned head. Now that she wasn't needed for this moment, Barbara decided to check up on something.

Back inside her tent, Barbara opened her phone and called upon her other aunt.

"Hey auntie-"
====

"-was wondering about your current search." Desire heard from her dear niece.

"Hello dear, I do apologize, I am trying my best to divine the location of the manufacturer of your seltzer water. Its just that a...situation has come up."

The fortune teller/P.I was currently in her abode on a beach somewhere. Shirtless, the woman's breasts covered the top of her thighs.. Her nipples were straight from the cool breeze that had invaded her room.

14523312121.content:
A knock on the door broke Barbara's concentration. It came from the front door of the trailer.

"Come in!" Corrine yelled out.

Opening the door to the trailer was Charlie, Barbara's youngest sibling. The girl had a vulpine grin on her face as she walked into trailer. She stretched a little and a thin sheen of sweat covered her body. No doubt from training in the early morning of the day.Under one of her armpits were a small box. Her mother walked pass her and came back with a towel. Corrine exchanged the box with the towel and looked it over.

"Barbara. It's for you." Corrine said. Barbara shot up and took the box. Charlie was in the background cleaning herself off, taking a half-hearted peek at the opening. Barbara exaggerated her scan of the box. Knocking on it and eyeing it, right until her mother coughed out.

"Sorry." Barbara spoke. She carefully opened the box and what came out of it surprised the trio of women. It was a note that was tied around an old fashioned squirting flower. Untying the note from the flora, Barbara read it out loud.

Dear, Slippey The Clown.

A gift from a big fan of your work. I hope you love it. It has a really cool surprise that will blow your pants right off.

Signed, An Admirer.

"Whoever this is, they were right! I love it!" Barbara exclaimed. "It matches my color scheme.And I also wanna see this surprise that will hopefully rip my pant right off my body!"

Placing it on her shirt the clown girl spun around in joy. Charlie rolled her eyes while Corrine rubbed her chin in thought.

"You got an 'Admirer' who gifted you a flower? Barbara, my darling, if you have a secret lover,you can come out with him!" Corrine said. Barbara placed her arm over her head in mock shame. She gave an Oscar worthy groan of spiritual pain.

"Mother dearest,please! I can't let my secret love come out now into the open, not until we have eloped!" Barbara declared. Finishing her little act, she smiled at her mother."Anyways, I'm going to show off to Peggy and Humphrey. Are you coming with me Charlie?"

Charlie shrugged and walked out with her older sister as they looked for their siblings.Corrine smiled at her daughters journey before she went back to her own work.

145233221.content:
"Thank you! Come again!" Stephanie spoke as she saw the crowd depart and dwindle. There were a few stragglers of course,which meant more cash for her fingers. She offered a few polite "Hellos" and "Welcomes" to these folk as they went up to her. She smiled at these folks, with said smile getting wider with a couple of grabs into some purses and wallets. She nodded and absentmindedly conversed, her body going on autopilot with each person that came.

Finally this second crowd left the woman, who now stood alone. She stretched and sighed. Walking into a dingy alleyway, Stephanie watched the area for any final "fans" of her.It was nearing the middle of the night, so she didn't have to worry too much of any passerbys,but one could never be too sure. Seeing none, the woman began to undress herself.Doing a routine that she had done many times before, Stephanie's body moved like clockwork. Taking shirts on,putting shirts in a plastic bag; taking pants off,placing pants in a plastic bag, and so on and so forth.

"Damn; note to self:never wear "McCormans" fishnet stockings ever again." She said. Currently almost out of her low-budget version of a showgirl (or was it a magician?), the girl calmly took a cheap-chain skirt and wrapped it around her lower body. Next she placed a black hoodie over her upper half,in addition placing a black wig over her head. Taking out a small mirror, she looked herself over. Puckering her lips, she applied makeup and covered her face up.

Now looking more like a goth on the wrong side of town, Stephanie smiled at her disguise. Just in time to, as she heard the running of feet coming to where she once was.

"Dammit, I thought she would still be here!" A gruff masculine voice yelled.

"She must've gotten away." Another voice responded.

"I hope she never comes back, she was taking business away from us."

"And I'll still do so." Stephanie smugly thought as she quickly hurried out the opposite end of the alley. She huddled into herself to give off a impression of someone two years younger, which did the trick of making some streetwalkers avoid her.

"I'm almost home, I can't wait to count my booty." Her greedy thoughts were interrupted by a one-hundred dollar bill on the street. Now she should've have known something was up with all the people who passed by it absentmindedly. But it was a one-hundred dollar bill, Stephanie just couldn't resist. Bending down, she giggled at the sight. Unaware how much her life would soon get changed.

Miki Aoki: Miki is an office worker from Japan. A beautiful woman in her mid-30's, Miki has garnered attention from everyone in the office she works at. She's known for being direct and efficient at work, but this has also made her rather cold towards her co-workers. She lives alone, doesn't have many friends, and has no significant other.

Miki happens to live next door to an abandoned house, which is supposedly haunted by the ghost of a woman in her 20's, who passed away from an illness, and continues to haunt the building, waiting for someone or something. Miki doesn't believe in the supernatural, but the ghost is quite real, has noticed Miki, and has prepared a bit of ghostly mischief for Miki to go through...
145233222.title: Miki Aoki

choices: While at home, Miki hears something in her house.
She hears tales of the house next to her and decides to prove them wrong
1452332221.content:
"Oh, she's coming right at us!" A male office worker spoke to his fellow co-worker. "Goodnight, Ms. Aoki! See you tomorrow!"

Ms. Aoki gave both of the men a curt nod in acknowledgement,but even with that the two men recoiled a little at the action. Current office manger of "Echo Techno", Miki Aoki, had developed a reputation as someone not to be trifled with.Replying to any slight done against her with harsh words or sending the scrutinized party a pink-slip.But even with that, there was no denying she wasn't a damn good administrator. Driving her floor with an acute mind, she single-handily made what was once considered a sub-par part of the company into an efficient force.

Miki walked ramrod straight pass her various other co-workers who packing up their things for the night. Watching as they gave her some form of goodbyes;either by a little wave or a nod of their heads. She barely replied back to any of them, and even then replying to those she liked with a professional nod.

Reaching her goal, she carefully ordered her papers inside an manila envelope. Finding it acceptable, she placed the envelope onto a lift and waited for them to travel upwards. After a moment or two, she heard a ping from an announcer on the lift's side. Now knowing that her boss had received his copy of the day's reports, she headed out.

Taking the stairs, for the elevator was packed at the moment, she made her way down two floors. Going through the door, she arrived in a changing room only allowed for the other middle-management in "Echo Techno". Miki watched as she saw her peers grabbing their purses, or baggage, or any other thing to take home.A majority weren't rushing to getaway though;these folk were instead happily chatting to one another about their lives. A rehearsed sight, Miki pushed past them to her locker. Quickly undoing the locker's combination, she plundered it and rushed out to find an elevator.

She happened upon an already emptied floor below the changing room.Heading straight for the elevator's buttons, she pressed the down arrow..She stood tapping her foot as she waited for the elevator to arrive. Once it came, Miki rushed inside, watching as the doors close and for gravity to take her down.

Now in the parking garage, Miki watched as co-workers drove off together in carpools, heard them speaking to their spouses or in some cases children, and one particular man talking to his grandparents. She sighed at all of it. Reaching her car, she opened the door, turned on her engine, and left her place of employment. Another day had gone by for "the most hard-working manager in the company", hooray!
1452332221.title: Miki Aoki

Sister Eve Terrence

One of four sisters(as in nuns) living at a parish in a reasonably large town. Eve is also the only sister there to be of a mixed race; a white father and a African mother. She spends most her day setting up for sermons and charities.

But one thing that nobody in the town can deny is that she possess a great beauty that makes boys sin in the night. Unfortunately,a dark force takes interest in her. This force decides that Eve would be a nice figurehead,using her to slowly corrupt the town.

Will Eve fall towards evil or will she break through this horror?
1452332222.title: Sister Eve Terrence

14523322221.content:
"Calm down. We have enough for everybody!" Eve called out to the picnic-goers who were crowding around the lunch table. "Please form yourself into a ordered line and we shall serve you soon."

It was just after Sunday mass and the parish had set up its picnic. The church did this every week to relieve stress; local chefs made food to be eaten and who in turn were paid by the town's treasury. The course this week were beef sandwiches, potato salad, and corn on the cob. Which was provided by "Brandon's BBQ", a homegrown restaurant.

Eve smiled as the people controlled themselves, watching as teenagers from Appleton High gave out plates and forks. She moved herself away to get a better view. Feeling relieved at sorting out the crowd, she headed towards a rambunctious horde.

"Now please put down those juice box children! Please just take one!" Sister Thalia exclaimed. Eve rolled her eyes at the younger sister. She was only 16 years of age,and even though Eve was only three years older than the girl, Eve felt like she was Thalia's mother! Thalia was both paradoxically meek and stubborn, and Eve did sometimes feel flustered, but she was apart of the parish nonetheless

Currently the girl was trying to get ten or so kids from taking multiple juice boxes.Her stature only being 5'0 made her appear as if the children were drowning her! Thalia was probably too ashamed to get some help,which would've actually have been a sound move. Eve stalked over and quickly began to speak.

"All right! Remember the conversations we always have? Don't go acting like you lot don't know what i'm talking about!" Eve announced as a few kids shrunk into themselves. "I keep telling you the same thing and that is: there is enough for every single one. Hey don't go walking off Jake, I see you. As I keep saying, if we have leftovers we will give it to you if you ask. So any child with more than one juice box, kindly place them back."

The kids swiftly apologized to Thalia as they put down their second,or third and sometimes fourth, juice boxes onto the table. After a few minutes of that,the kids dissipated,gravitating towards their parents.

"Oh thank the Lord." Thalia proclaimed. "I'm so sorry, I thought I could handle it. But those kids kept crowding around me and I didn't...."

"Say no more, Thalia." Eve interrupted the girl "You know I'll always be there for you. And so will Mother Nikki and Sister Grace and Sister Ester."

Thalia beamed at that and Eve left to look around for any problems plaguing the picnic. Turning to her right, Eve saw Sister Ester coming towards her.

"Eve, my dear! May I ask for your favor!" Ester exclaimed. She may have been bald, and had obvious crows feet in her eyes, but the woman held a certain air of vigor around her. Her booming laugh, or playful demeanor, made anything she spoke about sound splendid.

"Sure thing,Sister Ester. What do you require?" Eve replied.

"We're out of water and the teens are occupied at the moment. May I ask that you take a few cases from the vans outside the park? I would help,but Nikki is setting up the games right now and needs me."

Eve nodded at that,to which Ester grinned widely. The half-African girl watched as the older woman made her way to the Mother of the parish.Sighing, Eve went towards her assignment.

Parked just at the outer rim of the park were three vans. And as Eve got closer, she saw that a certain boy was there.

Standing on the side of one of the vans was Beckham E. Dowd. Looking distinctive with his black pompadour, long limbs, and a hawkish nose.A senior of Appleton High, nevertheless, he was someone enamored with Eve. As she was under an oath, Eve could never recuperate his feelings. But that didn't mean she couldn't enjoy his company,even if he wasn't her type to begin with.

"Sister Eve. How are you?" Beckham spoke aloud as he saw her approach.

"I'm doing well Beckham. Are there still cases of water in one of the vans?"" Eve replied.

The boy nodded. "Do you want some help with them? It wouldn't be too much of a hassle for me."

" I would and thank you for offering." Eve made her way over to where Beckham was standing, the boy moved behind the van he was near. Opening the doors, Eve could see the water cases stacked on top of each other. Beckham and Eve worked to get them out of the van, finishing after two cases were put down.

"I think these are enough. Lets bring them back to the picnic." Eve said to Beckham. Bending down, she was about to lift one of them up but she stopped.What felt like a cold hand brushed the back of her neck.Thinking it was some joke by Beckham, Eve turned around and saw...
14523322221.title: Sister Eve Terrence

145233222211.content:
She gasped at the ghostly figure right in front of her. It was like smoke had decided to form legs and move around. Eve stood with her mouth agape at the sight. Finding her courage though, she grabbed onto her rosary and started to pray.

"Don't go doing that. I already touched you. That little thing can't help you anymore." The figure proclaimed. It stoke Eve's cheek causing the nun to let go of her comfort.Eve's vision swarmed and twisted at whatever this being did, it was like going through a tunnel. "Eve? What's wrong." Beckham's voice sounded as if it was a million miles away and going farther and farther. Eventually it cut off leaving Eve alone in this white landscape. She huddled into herself,but she stayed strong. She had to endure whatever was coming after her. Eve would never fail against this adversary.

"Demon. I'm hurt. I'm not that bad." The figure spoke gently. "I just help people loosen up. I'm a Sin."
