Eve decided the best course of action was to go out and do her thing.

"I'll be there soon." Eve called out,and with that, Beckham footsteps could be heard disappearing down the hallway. She chewed the bottom of her lip as her thoughts began to go over her appearance. Her habit was usually more conservative,but with her now enlarged posterior, it seemed scandalous.

Not made for such a large part of her body, the habit outlined her rear greatly. It was obscene to show herself to the children looking like this.But she did love the conversation she had with them and they were always so happy when they saw her.

"I think I can conjure up something..." Eve thought, her eyes going towards her bed. Sloth,who appeared to be sleeping, didn't react as her blanket was torn away from her. Eve did her best not stare at the Sin's bare skin and opened peach.

Wrapping it around herself, it made for a good temporary cape. Thinking past that, she headed towards her closet. There inside of it were the books she read with the kids. It was a large stack, with over twenty books in it.

Reaching into the closet, she took out "Ten Little Bird", a delight for the kids on days like this. Smiling gently at the book, Eve walked away and to the door. Behind her, the gentle snores of Sloth ranged out.
145233222211111122.title: ...bit the bullet, and went to do the reading.

choices: Eve returns to her room,only to find Sloth gone
1452332222111111222.content:
It was twenty minutes after Eve left that Sloth's snores stopped, instead it was replaced by gently grumbles. The pant-less personification of lethargic energy flipped her blanket away from her body and proceeded to yawn.

"OhthatwasafastsleepIcan't." She quickly spoke out. Her once placid look was instead replaced by a one of energized happiness. Sloth jumped out of Eve's bed and began to walk away from it.

"Idoneedtogetsomeclothesplanoutmydayand-" Sloth rambled on. She opened Eve's bedroom door and began to walk out of it.Her form comically began to distort as her hips became stuck in the frame. Even though she was for all intents and purposes and incorporeal being. That being said, Sloth was too incompetent at the moment to transform her body into a more intangible density.She didn't seem to mind though as she continued to ramble even while focusing on getting out of said frame.

On the other side of the door was Sister Thalia. who was surprised by the sudden opening of her fellow sister's room. She wondered what was the cause of this and quickly noted it was probably the wind.Sloth rambled for a few more minutes until she finally got herself out. She quickly yelped, which was unheard by Sister Thalia, and slammed right through her.

Of course, being incorporeal while still possessing some mass caused the poor, smaller nun to stagger for a moment.A look of shock was followed by her face looking a lot more....placid.

"What...was that?" Thalia asked as Sloth walked away from her. Sloth barged into the parish's bathroom and began to summon tools for herself to use. Things such as brushes and toothbrushes and wax removal and other specialties.

She finished this cleanup with a flourish of perfume and by the end of it the Sin had transformed from her cute, cherub looking face into a beautiful hottie. She then proceeded to get some tight, tight fitting jeans over her bum, which somehow shrunk them down to normal,albeit a little large, proportions.

"AndIam....comp...huff...lete" Sloth spoke, her eyes tuning back into their half-dazed understanding. Sloth looked down and saw her once large potbelly replaced by a flat,trim stomach.

"Oh my god, I'm gonna starve." Sloth whispered in shock. "I need some of that human food. Just have some folks sacrifice it to me. I think. Was I? Its too hard."

And so Sloth began to shimmy her way towards Eve's little town, intent on spreading her power. Maybe?

1452332222112.title: Gluttony

choices: She felt a little peckish and wanting.
14523322221121.content:
...I'm Gluttony, do you have anything to eat? Probably not."

Eve looked slackjaw at the thing before her. It was a giant that loomed over the Sister. Gluttony's shadow covered the mixed girl's entire body.It,or she,didn't have any skin color of this Earth, instead colored a dark orange. That being said, parts of her were of a lighter shade, as if she had tan marks. Covering this immense Sin was an apron, on it were the words "Kiss the Cook? Feed Her Instead" with a plethora of food replacing the letters.

But the most striking thing about Gluttony wasn't just her height. No. She was also huge in width!

If the word "enlarged was given form, this orange figure would be it. She was over 14 feet tall, but the corpulent mass on her body looked ready to tip her over. In fact if Eve didn't hear her speak, the faithful girl would've sworn that the thing in front of her was a surreal stature. Each of her breasts were the size of small cars,but since they rested on an ocean of flab it didn't seem too outrageous.Still this blocked Eve's view of the being's face.Gluttony's large hips could've been the length of a light-pole horizontally. Gluttony's sides billowed out,barely contained by her apron. Flab, upon flab, upon flab and ad nauseam.

"*OINK*" A pig-like snort came from above. "I just realize I can't see you that well.Let me get a good look at your face. I wanna see who my Anchor is."

Seeing the mountain of fat move, the Sister could guess where this was going.Eve rushed back as fast as she could. Gluttony's was bending forward and her body was like a building crashing down. The Sister could see flab quake as it was brought to an angle.It did seem that Gluttony bit off more than she could chew though.

"I think I bent a little to muuucchhh!" Gluttony's body went wild as she tipped forward. Fat arms flailing as they tried to grab a hold of anything to stop the descent. Being in a void,not much was there. And with a mighty thump, Gluttony crashed down onto her front.

A shockwave of whatever the void was made of caused Eve to fly backwards. The girl landed on her rump. Coughing, Eve slowly got up and wiped herself off. Waiting for everything to settle, she saw the face of the woman talking to her.

She would've have been beautiful, if she were had lost weight and didn't possess a pig nose and ears. Gluttony's head was large, but a certain dimension about it made Eve feel as if it was a tiny bit smaller than the rest of her body. Twin face cheeks of flab smiled at Eve, who could now see the back half of Gluttony. Her ass was large, like mountains of fat stuffed into twin moons. The Sister was just at a right angle to see a pig tail right above the crack of Gluttony's rump.Weirdly, it seemed a hamster as large as Eve's head was resting on the top of Gluttony's cranial. Why it was there was anyone's guess.

Eve stared at the bizarre sight and she would've kept on doing that if she wasn't interrupted by Gluttony speaking.

"Hmm. A nice texture and skin tone. Fine figure, could go nice with some red wine." The Pig-Sin began to rattle. "Could also use some meat on the bones. I wish I brought some Texas steak with me, but oh well! I can't win every fight i'm in! Summing all of my data up: I believe I can make this dish work out just fine."

"What are you doing you disgust-" Eve was cut off by the Gluttony smashing the ground with her fist.

The white void disappeared and Eve was back at the vans.

"Uhhh. Eve? Do I need to call Doctor Angela? You were freaking out." Beckham's voice spoke. The Sister swayed for a bit,thankfully stopped from falling over by Beckham's help. An echo of what happened in the void flashed in her mind.

Eve turned to the boy with wide eyes, she remembered an event that was terrifying,but she couldn't vocalize it. Opening her mouth, Eve stopped when she felt a little empty,even though she had a light lunch before the picnic.
14523322221121.title: The Great Gourmand (Weight Gain)

choices: She discreetly gets extra meat on her sandwhich
145233222211211.content:
Eve sniffed her nose. A strong aroma whiffed through the air,causing the faithful woman's mouth to water. She whipped her head towards the west, seeing a cloud of smell coming from the park.Her mind swirled as she imagined the taste of beef. The sweet meat cooking on an open fire, dipped in sauce,and placed between two buns of bread. And Eve wasn't much of a meat eater in the first place,so she didn't understand what was happening.

"That wasn't there before,but it looks so good." Eve salivated in her own thoughts. Beckham gently placed his hand on her shoulders,making Eve turn to look at him.

"Sister,are you alright?" The senior asked. She shook her head to clear her mind. Pulling herself together, Eve nodded solemnly.

"I'm doing fine." Eve said. "Let us get back to work before the others get hungr-I mean thirsty."

Walking back to the vans, Eve and Beckham began to unpack. But every so often Eve turned to looked to the park and licked her lips.She shivered in anticipation as they finally got their water cases. Her stomach rumbled in her ears as she heaved up one case. The Sister couldn't wait to place the water down and feast on succulent food.

"I'll meet you there. I have to lock up the van here." Beckham called out. Eve was all too happy to comply as she rushed off with her case.

A distance away was a giant,though no one could see her except the nun who was running back to the park. Gluttony sat on her enormous rump,looking at the entire scene. A large smile was plastered on her face,but if any human knew what would happen next, they wouldn't be as happy at her merriment. She pushed herself up, causing her mountain of flab to move wildly. If she were solid, Gluttony's ass would've had imprinted on the ground.

Giving a hearty laugh,which shook her body greatly, Gluttony placed her meat-roll arms on to her stomach. The Hamster on her head finally woken up and scampered down her head,revealing a short mess of brown hair on Gluttony's scalp. The rodent found its way to her fat cleavage,snuggling gently into the canyon. It took a moment for Gluttony to notice the tiny beast.Looking down at it with a rueful grin.

"Oh,Impetuosity! You're awake! Whose a good girl?" A fat arm tickled the beast."See that girl? Yes? We're going see how far this fine meal will fill us up!" Or should I more appropriately say 'fill her' up?"

Gluttony thundered off towards the picnic, Beckham briefly feeling empty as she passed by. Looking around, he tried to find the source. But seeing as she was an invisible being in relative position to the world, he couldn't. Brushing it off, the boy went back to work.
145233222211211.title: Peckish and wanting (Gluttony Part 1)

choices: Eve goes onto a eating spree while the picnic goes on.
1452332222112111.content:
Eve helped Beckham place the water cases down next to the happy cooks. She smiled as they whispered out hurried "thanks" and began to help the thirsty masses. Beckham walked over to the sister and joined in her joy.

"Just in time too, right sister?" Beckham questioned.

"I believe so, Beckham." Eve stretched a little, but some part of her felt.. off. Putting that thought away for a moment, she continued. "Though I admit i'm quite peckish for a meal."

"Well, yes, of course Sister." Beckham replied. "I'll go get us some meals for us to gorge on."

Beckham began to walk towards the cooks, leaving Eve alone at the moment. The nun looked at the back of the retreating boy, she soon walked away to find herself a nice seat for herself. Making sure no one else was around, the sister slowly took her stomach into her hands. She gave the organ a nice squeeze and was surprised to feel a little plumpness around it.

"Where did this come from?" Eve questioned. "have I've really slacked off in my health?"

She was soon interrupted by Beckham bringing the two meals over. He kindly gave the girl her plate and walked off. Eve looked down at her meat, and for some reason, scoffed at it.

"You call this a meal?" Eve snarked.

She proceeded to find a nice place to tuck the sandwich and walked back to the cooks. She happily waited as the line was given their food. She was given an extra sandwich, Eve smacked her lips in anticipation. Walking back over to her seat, she got her the food given to her by Beckham and mashed it together with the food she had now.

She happily gulped down the contents of her food, smiling in sustenance-ecstasy.
1452332222112111.title: She discreetly gets extra meat on her sandwhich

145233222211212.content:
"I don't require any assistance, Beckham, I am quite well enough." Eve replied. Brushing her body off, she felt a sudden...weirdness to her form. Gently giving her stomach a light squeeze, she found herself a little...flabbier around the waist.

"Hmm. I need to go on a diet." She mused. "I appear to be a little unfit at this moment."

"I don't believe so sister." Beckham replied. Eve remembered she wasn't being that discrete in her musing, but she didn't feel embarrassed by the fact. She gave the boy a gentle smile.

"Kind words." Eve replied. "but still somewhat false in relations to me. I seem to have gained some minor expansion, that I'll soon fix."

Walking past Beckham, Eve headed towards the vans to get the water. The boy stared for a few moments, then shrugged and moved to the sister. The duo worked for a bit, with Beckham being slightly winded. But for Eve, it was a little more difficult in moving around. She could feel the heat dance across her skin, and was her habit tighter or was it just her? She also felt somewhat short of breath, was that also a problem or what?

It was after ten minutes did the duo unloaded the vans and began to walk away. With Eve a little behind the boy's tracks. He waited of course for her to follow.

Unbeknownst to the duo, a invisible behemoth watched on. She was mindlessly chewing on a small crate of apples, where she had retrieved them, one could only guess. She watched the nun walk over the horizon. A fat hamster scampered down her head towards the apple crate.

"Impetuosity, I believe this will be a find relationship between us, don't you think?" Gluttony spoke, unaware her pet was in the crate she was about to pour down her gullet. She was about to fill her mouth, right until she looked at the contents of her crate and was startled by the crate's occupant. Stopping ,she picked her hamster up, placed it back on her head, then continued to stuff her throat.

"Just hope we don't have to deal with the stick for awhile." Gluttony spoke, crunching down on her apples.

145233222211221.content:
...Come here child. I am Greed."

Eve saw the being that was once standing before her replaced by a strange sight.

Two golden calves were hitched to a vehicle that resembled a chariot,an egg,and a mobile platform. Pillows were scattered randomly inside of it; from silk to cotton, a feast of pillows were scattered everywhere. Laying on these pillows was a golden being. As in a figure that had actual skin of gold. The golden being was also huge. Eve could tell she was larger than her even though was reclining in her weird vehicle. Around 8 feet or so in size by Eve's estimation.

Peering closer, Eve could see more of this Greed.

Her face was motherly, reminding Eve of a younger Mother Nikki, making her somewhat uncomfortable. A kind smile was on her face, though Eve did feel a small twinge of fear inside of her. Her hair was sliver and reached her shoulders. It was straight,but tied in it were various coins,dollars,and jewels. They clinked as she was moved. On top of her head was a crown of iron with gems planted inside it.

Her body was the most drawing part of her.Jewelry, trinkets, and other eye drawing goods were draped everywhere they could find purchase.And Greed had a lot of surface area to find purchase. Six arms could be seen on this strange outsider's body,but that wasn't the most eye-drawing feature. Naked breasts bigger than basketballs rested on a stomach that was larger than any woman Eve had seen before. It completely blocked Eve's view of Greed's privates. A parody of motherhood that made Eve look at it in revulsion.The Sister could even see something squirm in the Sin's stomach.

But weirdly enough, it seemed as though Greed was trying to make herself appear friendlier. Five of her six arms were manipulating objects for a newborn. Two pairs of arms knitted a blanket,one arm held a rattle, one arm was checking a bottle, and the fifth arm held an "ABC" block. The sixth arm was open and was enticing Eve forward.

"Hmm. Don't worry child." Greed called out. Eve was reminded of the actress named "Catherine Zeta Jones" as she heard Greed speak. "You'll make a great Anchor and this place is great for a mother! A beautiful change from the 'Big Apple' ,though I will miss Wall-street. I'll explain later for your young mind."

"Wah.." Eve could only state. Greed snapped her fingers and Eve saw a flash.

She was back to the vans, Beckham's hand was on her shoulder.

"Eve. Are you alright? You acted all weird. Do I need to call the mother?" Eve looked over to the boy. She was about to something more, but she felt a strange presence pass over her.

Wait, was that maternal? No, what I mean was material.

Eve could feel a really pleasurable tingle pass through her.She moaned a little,but stopped herself from going any farther. Beckham looked back at Eve with a concerned look on his face. She blushed at his stare.

"I apologize for that." Eve said. "A unsightly urge came over me."

Beckham raised a eyebrow at that, but didn't follow up on that. He went back towards the vans and began to unpack the cases.Eve walked over to the boy to try and help him. She braked in her tracks as she saw a bulge in the back of his pants. His wallet could be seen trying to escape his pocket. As though an invisible hand had grabbed a hold of it and pulled it out. It plopped down onto the floor with a light smack.

Eve began to moved forwards and picked his wallet up. The nun was about to hand the wallet back, but the previous urge came over her. She bit the bottom of her lip and opened up the wallet. In it was about fifty or sixty dollars in cash. She stared for a few minutes, trying to stop herself, Eve couldn't resist it. She took the plunge.

"He won't miss a few dollars" Eve thought. Taking about five dollars away from Beckham, the Sister stuffed it under the headdress she wore. She smiled at her deed,making sure she didn't tip of Beckham as she handed back his wallet. The two talked for a bit before the headed back to the park with their water cases

From afar, a heavily pregnant golden figure watched the two walk away. She licked her lips with her frog tongue, delighting in her own action. Patting her giant stomach in joy.

"Good, child. Good." She whispered.

choices: Eve freaks out what happened to her BELLY?
Eve freaks out what happened to her MONEY?
14523322221122111.content:
Eve didn’t know what came over her, through out the day she stole money from the park patrons. A few dollars here a five there, by the end of the day she had fleeced fifty dollars from the park guests. For some reason she just couldn’t help herself, stealing money was so thrilling, the idea of all that cash excited her, and nobody ever seemed to notice.

“I can’t believe I did this, what came over me.” Eve exclaimed looking at the money in her hands, she felt a pang of guilt as she looked at her ill-gotten wealth, but the more she stared at it a strange sense of smug satisfaction grew within her. She pocketed the cash and continued on her way. All day her thoughts drifted back to the money, no her money, the money she deserved.

When evening rolled round, she prepared to go to bed and slipped into her pajamas. As she drifted off to sleep a large figure watched her. The demoness Greed looked at the sleeping young nun, pleased that things were going so well.

Let’s see how my little anchor did today. She said reaching for Eve’s ill-gotten gains. “Ugh! Paper currency, so disgusting, there is no weight to your sin, it doesn’t sparkle or gleam but I can fix that.” She clasped her hands around the wad of bills as a light shone from between her hands. When she opened her hands again the bills were replaced with fifty golden coins slightly larger than quarters. “Now to stow these away.”

Greed said lifting up Eve’s shirt and exposing her middle, she took a coin and inserted it into Eve’s belly button where it magically disappeared. She did that quite a few more times before she stopped to check her progress. By now Eve’s stomach just looked the slightest bit fuller and it no longer curved inward like it did before. Greed took a moment to enjoy the change in her vassal, she smiled deviously reaching out to feel it, she rubbed Eve’s middle hearing the magically muffled sound of coins moving. Pleased with the results she continued to insert the coins.

Coin after coin disappeared into Eve’s middle, each one causing her to grow. Soon her stomach started to look puffy and then it looked bloated. Bigger and bigger Eve swelled. As her clothes tightened Eve’s started to squirm, but Greed’s magic kept her from waking. “You know money is a precious thing, a treasure in fact just like a child, I want you to cherish these little ones and help them grow by gathering up more brothers and sister for them.” Greed commanded in a motherly way. As she stowed away the last coin, she admired her work. Eve lay before her with a pot belly looking like she was coming out of her first trimester. “You’ll make a wonderful money bag.” Greed said with an encouraging tone and gave Eve’s gurgling bulge a playful pat.

As the night gave way Eve would a waken to a surprise.

Eve just goes out and steals more money.
145233222211221112.content:
As Eve awoke the next morning, she noticed a strange heaviness in her middle. She rubbed her belly quizzically, in her groggy state the change in her waistline didn’t register at first, but it quickly didn’t matter as the caress of her belly brought her unexpected joy. She didn’t know why by she didn’t care that she was bizarrely bloated, but it felt right. She got up to check on her money and was shock to find it was gone.

“WHERE IS IT, WHERE IS MY MONEY.” She almost screamed, but she didn’t want people to come and check on her. She frantically started searching around her room looking for the money. When she couldn’t find it she started to panic. “Where is it I, I need that money.” Eve muttered as she was overwhelmed by a feeling of emptiness. She felt like something was missing, like she wasn’t a fulfilled as she should be. A hunger grew inside her but not for food she craved something else. “I need to get more, so guess I’ll just get more money.” She exclaimed as she licked her lips and she rubbed her belly.
145233222211221112.title: Eve freaks out what happened to her MONEY?

choices: Eve gets more and more ambitious with her thieving...
Eve freezes as somebody calls her name...
Eve is stopped by a police officer...
1452332222112211122.content:
Going to grab her habit, Eve froze, a hand still glued to her rounded belly. If she was going to... 'earn'... some money, she'd rather do it without her habit immediately giving her away. Turning her back on her usual clothing, she pulled open her drawers and started putting together a more casual outfit.

A few minutes later, Eve stood in front of her mirror, making sure her outfit looked respectable. After all, she might not be wearing her habit, but she was still representing her parish. Now clad in a simple white t-shirt, that hid her belly rather well, and blue jeans, Eve nodded and left her room. On her way to the exit, she spotted a few people entering. As they walked past one another, Eve's hand subtly shot out and snatched a few notes hanging out of their pockets.

=====


"Okay!" Eve said, clapping her hands together happily. "Where looks profitable?"

She was standing in the town square. All around her, tourists bustled around and locals peddled their wares. With the streets so densely packed, she had managed to swipe another ten dollars in her way to the town square. They now rested on her pocket, one hand clutching them tightly. The other was still attached to her belly, but why, she hadn't a clue.

"Guess I should just wander around for a bit. See if anything pops up..."

And so she did. For the next hour, Eve lapped the town square numerous towns, pausing in various crowded places to 'obtain' a bit more money. A few times, she was almost caught, forcing her to flee the square for a few minutes, but she always returned. By the end of the hour, her pocket was stuffed full of notes and coins, totalling almost thirty seven dollars in total.

Hopefully I don't lose all this... Eve thought to herself as she started another lap around the square, ignorant of the golden figure watching her smugly from afar...
1452332222112211122.title: Eve just goes out and steals more money

choices: To play it safe and just leave with the two-hundred...
To take a bit of a risk and open only one or two more registers...
Go big or go home! She attempts to open the third and fourth register!
14523322221122111221.content:
Ha, and another one down! Eve giggled as she deftly swiped a few dollars from the pocket of a man who had happened to walk past her. Glancing behind her to make sure he hadn't noticed, Eve stowed her ill-gotten bills with the rest of the ones she'd already collected that day. This brought her "earnings" up to a total of forty dollars even. Even still... Eve took another look around, noticing that the square was already starting to clear out as the midday rush came to a close, and people had slowly made their way home after lunch or after finishing whatever shopping they'd had to take care of that day.

Eve placed a hand under her chin, tapping it in thought as she pondered her next course of action. She'd already collected a fair amount of cash, a little bit more than yesterday in fact if she had counted right! However, that strange hunger she'd felt from before hadn't gone away, in fact, as the sister, unsuspecting of her current growing condition, placed a hand to her belly, she found that the feeling had only gotten stronger as she'd collected more cash. Normally, she'd have figured that a trip back to the church was in order, not only to store her newly pilfered cash, but also to check up on Beckham and grab a meal as well. However, something within her was telling her that for some reason this wasn't the right course of action. In fact, there was only one thought currently occupying her mind at the moment.

I need more! A voice echoed from within, the feeling reverberating throughout her body and making her shudder from the sheer demanding nature of the thought that had just made itself known. "But how can I possibly get more...everyone's already left..." Wondering for a few moments on where her next quarry would be, she realized that aside from a select few people in the square, her previous options had all vacated the immediate area. Gawking in despair, Eve whirled her head around, desperate to find even one crowd of people she could scout, and after a minute or two of aimless wandering, she sighed and slumped on a nearby bench in disappointment.

Guess that's that then... she thought to herself, looking up and staring listlessly into the distance, guess I have to call it a day if there's no one to keep pick pocketing... as her eyes started to focus on the store in front of her however, a thought began to bloom in her head. A vile, traitorous thought that had it come to her just a few days earlier, she'd have been disgusted at the fact that she'd have allowed it into her mind as a possibility. Now though, all she could think about was the potential influx of cold hard cash she could gain. The clothing store there is pretty popular...which means that if they've got a few registers... Eve began to shiver in excitement, absolutely thrilled at the idea that in one stroke, she could potentially go from having tens of dollars to hundreds! She shook her head, fighting to keep herself from squealing in delight at the mere notion.

Time to step up my game then...guess I'm glad I didn't wear my habit today... She thought to herself as she made her way into the store. The automatic doors slid open, granting her entry to her unsuspecting heist. Pretending to take in the stock of clothing items they had, what Eve was paying attention to were the number of people and security devices in the store. Luckily, since it was a smaller town, and what seemed to be a smaller branch of the normally large fashion store, it seems that all they had were security gates to catch shoplifters and a singular camera in the corner keeping an eye on the merchandise.

The shelves and racks were all adorned with many shirts, pants, and other garments of a menagerie of colors and styles. What really caught Eve's interest however, were the jewelry stands scattered lightly about through the different aisles. Eve could feel the glittering bits of metal and gems call to her, and she could feel herself wanting to walk over and snatch every piece of precious metal and leave the store completely devoid of any high priced items whatsoever.

Eve frowned as she took a deep breath to calm herself, as much as I want them, my plan is already ambitious enough as is, besides I don't really have a plan for the security gates and their item detection. With that, she walked through the second set of automatic doors and made her way into the store proper.

"Hey there! Welcome to Fantastic Fashions! Where we're guaranteed to find your style no matter the season! Please let me know if you need any help, or when you're ready to buy just head back here!" The clerk practically sang towards Eve, who eyed the front counter critically, before flashing a smile of her own back.

Good, only one cashier there...seems like they're a bit short-staffed today... Realizing that she had chosen the perfect time she threw a friendly wave to the cashier and took a look around the store. She knew she had to try and buy something in order to make the first part of her act convincing, and so as much as it killed her, she would have to spend a bit of money to gain so much more.

Swiftly making her way through the racks, she quickly grabbed a vibrant green blouse that seemed quite stretchy, and a pair of jeans that also carried the same quality in her size. Quickly returning to the front counter, she nodded to the cashier, who took the items and scanned them, doing a double take before starting to extend her congratulations to the woman in front of her. As she rang the items up however, Eve payed no attention to the words coming out of the clerk's mouth and instead focused on the motions of her fingers typing on the keyboard. Hmm...looks like she typed 76023 and then 4935... she mentally jotted down, now to-

"-irst time?"

"Excuse me?" Eve's eyes darted back to the saleswoman, who simply chuckled before repeating herself.

"I said 'is it your first time?'"

"First time?" Eve parroted, the look of confusion quite evident as the smile on the clerk's face vanished and turned to a look of surprise, her mouth hanging open slightly before she regained her bearings.

"First time...you know, being a mother? That is why you bought these right?" Awkwardly pointing to the clothes in front of her, Eve finally noticed just what kind of clothes she'd pulled, and her eyes widened as she recounted the words she'd just heard.

"O-oh u-uh...y-yeah!" She stammered nervously, face flushing as she realized she had to keep the story going somehow, "sorry uh...I was a bit caught off guard since I'm not really showing..."

"Oh I totally understand, planning is quite important when it comes to things like this." With an inward sigh of relief, Eve realized that the lady had dropped her suspicion and had believed her impromptu excuse.

Realizing that this provided her an in, Eve opened her mouth and spoke once more. "You're absolutely right, now that I think about it, you wouldn't happen to have anything for further down the line would you."

"Mmm...not on hand here, but I could check in the back right quick!" The clerk chirped cheerily, flashing a polite smile to Eve, who returned it with a grin of her own, though hers was more a look of the predator who had finally caught its prey.

"Please do, I'd very much appreciate it..." Eve giggled as the cashier headed away from the counter and across the store. Once she was out of sight, Eve climbed over the counter and hungrily took in the glorified cash case in front of her. It was a run of the mill electronic cash register with a digital display screen that currently was prompting her to login. Let's see...what were those numbers...7...6...0...2...3. She pecked each number down, and sure enough the register then prompted her for a pin number, alrighty...next numbers...4...9...3...5. With an emphatic 'ding' the register slid open, revealing the very thing Eve had been dying to see. A whole line of bills neatly organized into a row divided by their individual amounts that practically had her panting as she glanced around one more time to make sure the clerk wasn't headed her way.

Quickly taking all of the money out she quickly realized that there was around two-hundred dollars that had been in the register. The bills were quickly stuffed into her pockets with a malicious cackle as she discreetly shut the register and went to make her way out of the store. Before she climbed back over the counter however, she realized that there were at least three or four more registers ripe for the picking. She knew it was likely a terrible plan, as she could easily slip out of the store undetected with her money as it was now. However, the idea of potentially quadrupling her money? Well, it had her biting her lip in frustration as she felt the hunger return. It was a very risky move, and if she were caught it could very well lead to her getting arrested...

After a few minutes of her thoughts warring amongst themselves, she finally stood firm and decided...
14523322221122111221.title: Ramping Up the Theft...

145233222211221112211.content:
Feeling her wealth was endangered Eve hurried out the store right as the clerk started heading back. The Golden Demoness sighed in relief. “That was close the dear’s a little reckless, I can’t look out for her all the time.”

Eve hurried down the street and quickly ducked in an alley. She couldn’t believe what she had just done, her heart was going wild, it had been so exciting! So much money! she excitedly thought, taking out her cash and enjoying the sight. It sent a perverse joy through he body, a shiver crawling up her spine.
“I don’t know what that lady was talking about, but these are my only babies.” Eve said giving the bills a playfully kiss.

As she put away her cash, she finally looked at the clothes she had snatched. “Are these maternity clothes, Oh well, I guess their mine now not that I would need them. Eve said aloud to herself. After that profitable day Eve decided to head home, as she did, she noticed a homeless man begging for change. Instinctively she started reaching for her cash, but stopped herself as a selfish thought entered her mind. “Why should I give away my money, its mine I earned it myself? “She thought, with this selfish realization she scowled at the vagabond and walked past him with a huff.

After she returned home to settle in for the night, she was eating dinner when she noticed the story on the news. Pickpockets in the Park!

Great, I better avoid that place for a while, maybe I’ll check out the mall tomorrow. She said to herself as she slipped out of her clothes. She took out the new shirt and put it on wearing it over her underwear. “This thing might be huge, but it makes a great night shirt, so roomy.” Eve said admiring herself in the mirror, the shirt draped over clearly meant for someone bigger.

As Eve slumbered the demoness returned to give reward her faithful anchor. “You’re becoming such a greedy little monster.” Let’s see fifty dollars your first day and now two hundred and forty that is wonderful, more than quadruple the amount, that deserves a reward. She put some of the money aside and gathered up the rest doing what she did before. In her grasp the money changed to gold coins and proceeded to lift up Eve’s new shirt.

She put her hand over Eve’s belly button like a funnel and slowly poured the coins into her hand. As the coins disappeared into her Eve moaned and squirmed, her once modest bulge swelling bigger and bigger. It inflated like a balloon the coins becoming visible as it took on a lumpy shape. When the last coin vanished, the demoness took a moment to inspect her servant. “That’s a little noticeable.” She said noting the weird shape to Eve belly. She put her lips over Eve’s belly button and gave a little puff. The presence of the coins disappeared as her stomach rounded out looking more like she was pregnant and very overdue.

“There my precious little moneybag, sleep tight.” Greed said as she lowered Eve’s brand new and now slightly tight shirt.

145233222211221112213.content:
As much as Eve wanted to take her earnings and safely escape the store, some unknown force propelled her towards the other registers. Reaching the first, she quickly inputted the code, a gleeful giggle escaping her mouth as it slid open, revealing another pile of bills. Eagerly scooping them up, she stuffed them into a less full pocket, not even taking the time to count them.

Oh, yes! Eve thought as she slid the register closed and stepped to the one next to it. More... More... MORE!

Punching the code in, her eyes lit up as yet more bills were revealed. Grabbing them, Eve hummed happily to herself as she ferried handful after handful of notes to her pockets. Quickly emptying her third register, she was about move onto her fourth when she heard footsteps approaching the door behind her. Quickly vaulting the counter, Eve returned to where she had been standing, making sure to hide any visible notes.

"We do have a few bigger items in stock," The woman announced, appearing in the doorway, various clothing items draped over her arm. Spreading them over the counter in front of her, the woman glanced at Eve, who was doing her best to act interested. "Anything strike your fancy?"

"Perhaps this?" Eve said, lifting a yellow top. "I really like the design, but yellow? Not really my colour... I don't suppose it comes in, say, white?"

"I'm not sure..." The woman replied, checking the label. "But I'd be happy to go check for you!"

"That'd be great, thank you!" Eve said with a warm smile. But as the woman turned to head back into the store room, she called out again. "Actually, do you also have these, but in blue? Oh, and this..."

=====


After giving the woman a huge list of clothing she was curious about, Eve waited until she had left the room before vaulting the counter and returning to the penultimate register. Quickly opening it, the cash held within quickly vanished into Eve's pockets. Sliding it closed, she moved onto the final till, a mad grin on her face.

So much... She thought, breathing heavily. So much money! And it all belongs to me...

Shoving the contents into her pockets, Eve slid the till closed and returned to her side of the counter. She waited for a few seconds before shrugging. Leaning over the counter, she grabbed the scan gun, scanned a few items, removed the tags and draped them over her arm before walking out, making sure to keep her head down.

=====


Veering down a secluded alley, Eve made sure she was alone before letting out a satisfied cackle. Dropping her stolen clothes, she pulled her 'earnings' out of her pockets and gently set them atop a nearby trashcan. The mere sight of all that money, piled atop one another in a beautiful mountain, made her feel satisfied, as well as a little excited. Counting through it, her eyes slowly lit up.

One thousand and forty seven dollars... She thought excitedly, admiring the neat piles she had arranged her money into. Ohhhhh, yes...

Mother. Mother. Mother.Mother.

The word bounced around in Eve's head like a pinball in it's machine. Suddenly a gurgle reverberated in her ears,causing Eve's eyes to pop up in shock. Gently touching her stomach, she could feel a soft squirm inside of her.

"What is this?" Eve thought as she felt the squirm causing her insides to thump like a drum.A loud cough broke Eve's concentration. Looking across to Beckham, Eve could see the boy looking worried for the sister. Straightening herself, Eve smiled back at the senior.

"Ahem. Apologies,Beckham. I was just feeling a little under the weather." Eve explained. "I'm fine now. Let us get back to moving these cases."

Beckham shrugged and walked side by side with Eve. But even with that being stated, the nun was still preoccupied with her squirming stomach. She felt a little sick right now, but couldn't quite place her mind down onto what was happening. Her arms gently wrapped themselves around her middle,but Eve couldn't quite shake the feeling.

That was until the squirming stopped. Eve felt a rush of relief pass through her body as she finally felt quite good again. Smiling to herself as she made her way over to Beckham,who had already taken the cases of water down onto the ground. The two chatted for a bit as the nun's mood brightened;she was unaware of the change in her body though. A small paunch had appeared and in it was a little surprise.

The duo walked away,unaware of another watching them. In the distance was Greed in her strange vehicle. Binoculars were held by one of her many arms as Greed looked at the retreating Eve. Placing the binoculars into her cleavage, Greed swooned at what she saw.

"Theft, Larceny. Do you see those two over there? Focus on the sister." Greed proclaimed. "She's going to become a mother! Isn't that wonderful? Well, it wouldn't be in good taste if we left her all alone. Let's get going."

The two golden calves mooed softly to their golden master's response. The two beasts of burden moved slowly after the cursed girl.

Eve felt a bit of anger at this strange woman, mostly because this woman was a near exact copy of her. The same hair, same eyes, same height, even the details of the habit were exact. The only difference was her skin was a bright shade of green and she had a pair of small dog ears.

"You... you vile creature! Why have you stolen my appearance?" Eve asked, very angry.

"Eep! Sorry! You don't like me taking your form?" Envy asked, freaked out. "...alright, let me try this."

With that, Envy turned into smoke again, and reshaped herself. When she took a human form again, she was now a tall, slender woman with black hair and green eyes in a blue dress. She still had her green skin and dog ears.

"Is this better? Do you like this form more?" Envy asked.

Eve frowned. "I guess, but why have you come to Earth?" She asked.

"Ah, I'm supposed to spread envy around the town. It is my name, after all." Envy answered. "Oh, I do hope we get along. You are supposed to be my anchor after all. I hope you won't hate me too much."

With that, Envy snapped her fingers, and the world faded.

It wasn't that hard,but after thirty minutes of walking around,she could feel her sweat dribble down her body. Doing her best to keep her back straight, she moved herself over to the park's public bathroom and headed inside.

Splashing some water on her face, Eve decided she needed to look at her larger assets. Pulling the habit over her head, she stared at how tight her white T-shirt appeared to be.

145233222211222222111.content:
As Eve and Beckham returned to the picnic, Eve started taking note of everyone. She could see the joy on all there faces, all the fun games good food to enjoy. The parish always did it best to make the picnic fun, even setting up a face-painting booth for today. There was a surprising ammount of energy, but overall, everyone was enjoying themselves.

And yet, something about all this annoyed Eve. Like there was something... wrong. She couldn't quite place her finger on it.

Walking past the face-painting booth, Eve took notice of a mirror. It seemed somewhat askew, which only served to irritate her. Frowning, she stepped into the booth.

"Apologies, but your seems to be a bit crooked." Eve said to the man running the booth. "Please allow me to fix it."

The man nodded, and Eve re-adjusted the mirror. As she did, she saw the reflection of her face. With her caramel complexion combined with her shiny brown hair and green eyes, many considered her a beauty. She had seen her reflection many times before, but for some reason, she felt... entranced by her own face today.

"Um, Sister Eve?" The man running the booth said. Eve snapped out of her distraction, and turned to the man.

"I apologize, I was lost in thought." Eve said. "Enjoy the picnic." On that, she quickly left the booth, a bit confused.

Off in the distance, invisible to all, PRIDE was petting Vanity's head as she watched Eve leave the booth. The tall sin couldn't help but smile.

"It's a nice start." PRIDE said. "But we need a way to REALLY bring out the arrogance. Perhaps a small enhancement to her curves is in order again."

As she spoke, the door to a nearby house suddenly changed shaped, becoming golden and opulent. The new door opened, and a figure stepped out. The door shut, and turned back into its original form.

This figure was a beautiful, pale woman with silver hair and eyes, and and hourglass figure that, while nowhere near PRIDE's, was still impressive. She was wearing a green belly-dancer outfit.

PRIDE looked down and noticed the woman. Upon seeing her, PRIDE smiled.

"Ah, Tara. You've arrived in time." PRIDE said.

"Of course, Lady PRIDE." Tara replied. "It's always a joy to be at your side. Every moment where I am not near your unmatched beauty and impeccible perfection is heart-breaking."

PRIDE smiled at the compliments, while Vanity rolled her eyes. Tara was one of PRIDE's personal harem. All of them loved PRIDE in their own way. Tara's way was that she was completely and utterly devoted to the sin. Not a day went by where Tara wasn't praising PRIDE. The sin even swore that Tara worshiped the ground she walked on.

"I have a potential job for you." PRIDE said. "I want you to keep an eye on my anchor. I'm planning to turn her into a curvy, arrogant woman, but she's tough to crack."

"Of couse, Lady PRIDE!" Tara said. "For someone as absolutely perfect in every way as you, only the best of the best of the best is worthy to be in your presence. In fact, the very sun should be eternally grateful that you allow it the privilage to shine off of your radiant and flawless-"

"Tara, you're rambling again." PRIDE said.

"GAH! APOLOGIES! I didn't mean to upset you! I'm unworthy to be in your magnificent presence. I will redeem myself by completing my task!" Tara yelled, before running off.

"I hate her." Vanity muttered.

"You're just jealous." PRIDE snarked.

----

14523322221122222221.content:
...Please keep away from me. I am despair"

It was as if the figure's previous gusto and might flew out of her like deflating balloon. Eve was so shocked by the sudden change in tone that it took her a minute to realize she had to look up. Up. Up.

The figure was over 20 feet high,and if she wasn't a supernatural entity,she would probably be the tallest living animal on Earth. (Whales are bigger length wise than height wise.)

Her skin was a dark gray and Eve was reminded of stone.But the really surreal thing about the Sin was that she appeared to be a stick figure. As in this despair was supernaturally pipe-like in shape.Eve could've fit her entire hand around this Sin's waist. The only wide parts about her were her lower half and her chest area. Protecting the modesty for her crouch and leg area were what appeared to be a silk skirt and weirdly hilarious spider slippers.

Eve couldn't quite see the chest area of the stick figure creature--it was as if a cloud of dust had gathered near her upper half--but she could faintly see more torn wrappings around the area. And in this cloud of dust, Eve could also make out six other arms besides the ones that reached just above her knees. They were smaller in length than the two main limbs.Eight glowing orbs faintly illuminated themselves in the misty aura,looking straight down at the tiny Sister. Eve backed up and held her rosary up.

"Stay..stay back!" Eve proclaimed. "I have God's power demon. You can not touch me!"

"Please practice what you preach." despair said.But to Eve's ears it seemed to be more of the wind's words. "I just realized I don't wanna be here. I'm back to being ole' me and my mind is clear again.I shouldn't have chosen you as an Anchor. I'll let you go in a little bit."

"As an Anchor? What are you talking about beast?" Filled with questions, and a sense of protection against the giant,Eve walked forward. She touched the hand of the Sin,but let go as she heard a loud bird caw.

"What?" She looked up and saw something swoop out of the cloud. Resembling a nightmare mixture between a raven and spider, it seemed to be coming after Eve.The girl ran, but the thing had air superiority. It soon was right above her. The Sister could only turn around as she saw the shadow of the nightmare cover her own. Looking up, the thing didn't come down to attack. Instead it dropped what appeared to be a solid, blue...tear?

"Oh Father,Lord in Heaven, please let me live." Eve thought as she saw the tear aim straight for her face.

Eve braced for pain as the tear collided with her head. It splashed against her, releasing a blue glop. Eve wasn't prepared for that,nor was she prepared for the goop beginning to move. The Sister could feel the sticky, and somehow viscous, blue substance crawl across her face. It traveled down the throat, causing Eve to thrash and try to get it out.She coughed and coughed and coughed and coughed and coughed and...

----

"Eve! Eve! I need the doctor! What do I do? Do I leave or stay here?" Beckham's voice brought her back from the brink. Her eyes shot upwards.Feeling as if she was choking, she flailed around madly. Eve stopped as she realized she was back near the vans.

"Eve! What happened? Do you need a doctor?" Beckham asked. His face showed distressed for the Sister. "You gone all spacey, then all of a sudden you started coughing! I'll call some hel-"

"NO!" Eve yelled. She immediately realized she had broke her facade of being an stoic hard-worker. Wiping her forehead, she huffed out. Looking back at Beckham, she gave the boy a stern stare. "I'm fine. Don't tell anyone what happened. Let us just get these water cases to the picnic and..."

She stopped and stared ahead at the trees and grass. Everything just seemed less...vibrant than before.

145233222211222222211.content:
Eve couldn't explain why, but she started feeling a little... empty inside. Looking around, she saw everyone having a goodd time at the picnic. The smiles of the adults, the laughtter of children, the kindness of the other sisters.

And yet, it all seemed so... pointless. Eve didn't have words to describe it, but she felt a little down, like she shouldn't even be here. This was supposed to be a day of merriment and joy. Why did she feel so sad?

"Something wrong, Eve? You look kind of glum." Beckham asked, concerned.

Eve shook her head. "I don't know. I feel... sad for some reason." She said. "It's a happy day, but... I don't know. I'll take the waters back to the picnic, but I think I'd like to be left alone for a bit after that."

"You sure?" Beckham asked. "They're doing a ring toss later. You don't wanna take part in that"

Eve shook her head. "I don't know, I just don't feel... motivated anymore. She said. She sighed, then both she and Beckham grabbed the waters and walked off.

From afar, a giant woman stood, invisible to all except Eve, though she wasn't looking that way at the moment. Her pet, the raven-spider from before, was perched on her shoulder. She looked glumly at the picnic.

"Everyone looks happy." despair said softly. "What am I doing here? What's the point? The universe'll just die some day, so why bother with fun? Come on, Calamity. Might as well see how this goes... not that it matters in the end."

despair walked off towards Eve, Calamity flying behind her.
145233222211222222211.title: An Empty Feeling (despair 1)

1452332222112222222111.content:
After giving the waters to another of the sisters to set up, Eve started to just wander around. The bit of sadness she felt was troublesome to her. Why couldn't she muster up the willpower to feel happy?

Looking, she saw an empty bench, a small bit away from the picnic. Sighing, she walked over to the bench and sat down. From her new seat, she could see the entire picnic. It was so bright and colorful and... happy.

Frowning, Eve looked down at the ground. That was when she felt something she wasn't expecting: her eyes beginning to water. She couldn't stop herself, and a few small tears fell from her eyes. She reached a hand up to wipe away some of the tears... and noticed something odd. Instead of being clear, her tears were a dark blue.

She was so confused that she didn't notice another sister walking up to her. Looking up, she saw it was Sister Kelly. Only about 2 years older then Eve, Kelly was about the kindest soul you could ever meet. Everyone who spoke to Kelly said she was a ball of sunshine, always striving to make people as happy as possible.

"Sister Eve, what seems to be troubling you?" Kelly asked, a little concerned.

"I'm... I'm not sure." Eve replied. "I feel... upset. Sad. Like the joy of of today's festivites means... nothing. And I'm not sure why. I WANT to feel happy and cheery but..."

Sister Kelly sat down on the bench next to Eve, and put a comforting arm on her shoulder.

"You needn't fret, Eve." Kelly replied. "There are somedays where a person just feels blue. There isn't much one can do about it. But know this: no matter what, I and the other sisters will always be there to lend a hand, whenever you need it."

Eve looked at Kelly and smiled. "Thank you." She said, now smiling a little. "You always seem to know just what to say."

Kelly smiled brightly. "It's almost time for the annual baking contest." She said. "Mrs. Bell is really hoping her pumpkin pie wins this year."

Smiling a little more, Eve got up from the bench, Kelly following suit, and the two walked off.

Unknown to them, despair was a ways away, Calamity on her shoulder. She had seen the interaction.

"Huh. Kelly certainly seems like she's happy." despair said. "I really don't want to bring her down... but it's likely I will without meaning too. I always do. I ruin everything."

Sighing, despair decided to shrink herself down to a more human height, hoping Eve wouldn't spot her like this, and followed the two nuns.
----
At the baking contest, Eve's mood...

The baking contest was going along rather smoothly. It only had four contestants: the elderly Mrs. Julie Bell and her pumpkin pie, the cheerful Mr. Emmet White and his scones, the lovely Ms. Jessica Rains and her blueberry pie, and repeat winner Mr. Craig Drake and his donuts.

Everything with the contest was bright and cheerful, and it was actually helping to improve Eve's mysteriously depressive mood. It wasn't much, but at least Eve was able to muster a smile.

Sister Kelly looked over at Eve and saw her smile. This made Kelly herself smile.

"Look at you, Sister Eve." Kelly said. "Maybe earlier was a fluke."

"Perhaps." Eve replied, looking over the entries to the contest. They did look quite delicious, but for some reason Eve couldn't tear her eyes away from Jessica's blueberry pie.

As Eve watched the judges look over each entry, she casually set her hand on her stomach... and was met with something odd. Looking down, she saw that her stomach seemed a little bigger. Not totally noticable in her habit, but still there. Stranger still, her stomach felt a bit tight and jiggly.

After a few minutes, the judges finally came to their decision.

"And the winner of this years baking contest is... Jessica Rains and her blueberry pie!" The judges announced. Cheers ensued as Jessica was given the blue ribbon.

Eve watched all this unfold, and felt a tiny bit happy. But that misery was still there, and she still had no explanation for what was going on.

"And so,the party set out to find greater treasures in the Hall of the Crimson King." Emily stated.Stretching her back a little, the nerdy girl smiled at her troupe.

Percy looked relieved,Trent nodded at her statement, Marcus' grin grew even wider at the thought of treasure, while Nikki and Bradley seemed to have somewhat more subdued reactions. Scratching her chin,Emily thought up her next few words.

"Okay everyone let us take a break. We'll meet back in thirty minutes." Emily declared. The others breathed out a sigh of relief and walked around her shop. Some going to the little platter Emily had set up, while others laying on the large couch she had in the back. Emily got up from her place at the front of the table and began to go into her storage room.

"I'll take another look at what I have; never be too sure if something is missing."

Emily's place was adequately large, with the front of her store, a small rec room, and a storage place for all of her cards. Managing to get the place at a good price. Upon moving into the storage room, Emily began to take stock. She rattled off her boxes and various other paraphernalia in her head. Yawning slightly, she kept about her progress.

Something stopped her however, a bright flash of metal caused Emily to stop in her place.

"What was that?" Emily stated. She began to move towards the disturbance.

Pushing away some boxes, Emily could see the cause of her search. It appeared to be a metal book with some engravings in it. It was around the size of one of her RPG books and somewhat thicker than one. Emily's eyebrow shot up at the object.

"I don't remember having this here. Did this come with the shipment I had received?" She proclaimed. Putting a hand above the book, she was about to open it before a flash of light blinded her.

"Fu- Okay, what just happened?" Emily screamed out and she was about to continue if it wasn't for that fact that alien sensations tickled her body. She looked around at the area she was in. Instead of the storage room of her store, she stood upon a hill. A vast field of flowers stretched from one end of the horizon to the other.

"Where am I?" Emily stated. She looked around her area for a bit, before she looked down. Upon doing so, she gasped in shock at her own body.

"I'm...i'm ...i'm.." Emily stuttered out her proclamation. Her voice a little higher than her normal tone. "I'm a goblin!"

And she was exactly what said, a fantasy styled goblin.

Standing around 3'4, Emily surroundings seemed to loom over her. She sniffed with her nose in shock and immediately her hands shot up. Emily's goblinoid body gave her a pointed snozz. It also granted an enhanced sense of smell, as the woman could sniff out scents that she couldn't have before her transformation. Still, it would be nice if she didn't have a nose like a twig.

"Eeek!" Emily covered her body to try and give herself some modesty. "What the hell is this!"

Emily cringed at her high pitch squeal, but she did have more important things to worry. She would push her close survey of her form towards the bottom of the list of important things happening to her at the moment.

"First things first:where am I?"

1452332222222111.content:
Emily swiveled her head around to look around where she was at. Her eyes wandered to the shadows of the grass, the open sky, and vast sea of green. The goblin part of her ran into overdrive as the foliage surrounding made her feel small and unprotected.

Danger. Horror. Protection. Need. Want. Now

She scurried like a rat being chased by a hawk. Her breath puffed from her small lungs as the goblin lady ran through the thick grass. Finding a nice little hovel to dive into, Emily took her chance. Using her hands, the goblin began to enlarge the hole. She shifted her body to fit inside, looking out from the dank dirt to the outside world.

She felt the dirt touch her bare skin, not reacting to the coldness or its strange texture. The grass shifted in the wind,nothing else came from it.

"Phew" Emily audibly said. "I was freaking out over nothing." Moving herself out of the place, she did her best to control her emotions. Looking around again. She noticed something familiar about this place.

"Wait, this is Old Henry's farm." She announced. And upon saying that, a voice called out.

"Whose there?" Old Henry called out. Emily saw him through the grass,but from Old Henry's perspective, it was frightening.Red, baseball sized eyes stared straight into the face of Old Henry. The Old man screamed,causing Emily to herself become frightened. Going onto on all four, she ran off into the distance.

"Sorry for scaring you Henry,at least I know where I'm at." She thought.

With that, the two shook hands and began to walk out of the office. They spoke for a few minutes, causal things about lives. They stopped upon seeing a red colored door.

"And we'll just show you the facility.Oh and make sure you're covered." Mr. Ashton spoke. The pair began to dress up and walked inside the area. Their men mulled about over a couple of machinery,chemicals, and things Cynthia didn't quite get.

"Oh, sir." A worker called out. He raced towards the pair and quickly Mr. Ashton began to speak with him. Cynthia listened in on their conversation for awhile but eventually her eyes were brought elsewhere.

It seemed a vial of something was slowly rumbling off an cabinet. Why the cabinet's doors weren't closed, who knows? But on the vial was something that caught Cynthia's eyes.
14523322222222221.title: Cynthia Thomas

choices: ...the blue wouldn't come off of Cynthia's face.
145233222222222211.content:
On the chemical vial was a label that read "experimental blueberry mixture". Cynthia would want to take a closer look, but the vial was rather high up, Cynthia, depsite being 38, only stood at 4'6''.

"Hey, Mr. Ashton!" Cynthia called. "Why's this cabinet not closed? There'd be some dangerous checmicals in here, and any of them spilling is a lawsuit waiting to happen!"

"Oh, those? We've tested them, and they're perfectly safe." Mr. Ashton replied, walking over. "These chemicals are meant to help food production, with the hopes of ending world hunger."

"I see." Cynthia said. "So, that experimental blueberry mixture does what exactly?"

"Ah, it makes blueberries grow much bigger." Mr. Ashton replied. "Very simple, but useful for berry farms. Everything in this cabinet is guranteed safe for crops."

Cynthia was intrigued, but she still thought the cabinet should be closed. So she grabbed the cabinet door, and started to close it. But the sudden grabbing motion made the cabinet wobble, and the blueberry formula fell from its perch. The vial had not been closed, so the formula spilled out, and landed on Cynthia's face.

There was total silence in the lab. Cynthia was stunned, and Mr. Ashton was upset.

"I am so sorry Ms. Thomas!" Mr. Ashton apologized. "You're right! I should have closed that! We can't afford a lawsuit right-"

"Mr. Ashton, this was partly my fault, so you're not being sued." Cynthia replied. "Next time, just make sure your chemicals are properly locked up."
------
A little while later, Cynthia left Lakewood Chemicals, and went out into the parking lot. She got into the passenger seat of a silver sports car. In the driver seat was her business partner, Dana Willard.

"What happened to you?" Dana asked, noticing the blue smudge on Cynthia's face.

"Accident that was mainly my fault. Spilled liquid, but I was assured it's safe." Cynthia said. "Let's just get back to the office. We've got more businesses to help today."

Dana just shrugged and drove off. However, unknown to either of them, the chemical wasn't meant to be used on a human. So, a change was affecting Cynthia right now. Because now...
145233222222222211.title: Blue on My Face

14523322222222222.content:
Jane Carrington - A brilliant and excitable woman, Jane has been obsessed with space her entire life. At the age of 28, she achieved her dream of becoming an astronaut. Now 35, she's been on several missions. She's just come back from a mission exploring a cavern that had just been discovered on Mars. However, something in that cave is about to cause a VERY big change in Jane.

Mary Preston - A 26 year old social media star, Mary is completely obsessed with attention. She doesn't care about anyone except herself, and is incredibly vain and mean. During one of her videos, she decides to try out a brand new make-up pack to increase her views, unaware that she's about to increase something else.
14523322222222222.title: More Girls

145233222222222223.content:
Lana Armstrong - Lana is one of THE most popular dancers in the world. At 34 years old, Lana has made an incredible name for herself with her gorgeous looks, her almost hypnotizing dancing, and her wonderful personality. Lately, though, she's been looking for something to give her routine an extra oomph. And she certainly finds it.

Miyuki Tanaka - Nicknamed "The Goddess of the Ring", Miyuki is one of the most feared professional wrestlers around. Only 27, she's already won numerous championships, and has a reputation as being unstoppable, beating the tar out of female and male opponents. Her on-camera persona is wild and cruel, and off-camera, she's arrogant and VERY full of herself. But something's about to change both her fighting style, and herself.
145233222222222223.title: More Girls

info.brief_description: Girls start finding themselves growing in all the right places at all the wrong times.
